0.title: Canada comedian flies to Ukrainian border to serve as combat medic; shares video
0.article_body: Canada comedian Anthony Walker has traveled to the Polish-Ukrainian border to serve as a combat medic. Walker, who described himself as "temporary Ukrainian", shared a video on Twitter. "This war affects everyone...I would go to fight for the freedom that Ukrainians deserve, my family deserves, and you deserve," he said.

1.title: ED summons Nawab Malik's son Faraz in money laundering case
1.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has summoned NCP leader and Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik's son Faraz Malik in connection with the Dawood Ibrahim-linked money laundering case. BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis had earlier alleged that Faraz was the signatory on a property deal involving Dawood's aide. Nawab Malik has approached Bombay HC seeking to dismiss the money laundering case against him.

2.title: If Putin wants to kill himself, he should do what Hitler did in 1945: Ukraine's UN envoy
2.article_body: During UN General Assembly's session on Ukraine crisis, Ukraine's UN Ambassador Sergiy Kyslytsya described Vladimir Putin's order to put Russian nuclear forces on alert as "madness". "If he wants to kill himself...he doesn't have to use...nuclear arsenal, he has to do what the guy in Berlin did in a bunker in 1945," Kyslytsya said referring to Adolf Hitler's suicide.

3.title: Americans don’t need to worry about nuclear war: US Prez amid Russia-Ukraine conflict
3.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that Americans don't need to worry about a nuclear war. This comes amid ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine with the former putting nuclear deterrent forces on alert. A White House official earlier said, "We are assessing President Putin's directive and at this time, we see no reason to change our own alert levels."

4.title: Tripura High Court bans sale of meat products in public places
4.article_body: Tripura High Court banned the open sale of meat on streets or in public places in the state. It has also asked the Agartala Municipal Corporation ( AMC) to work on a long-term plan for setting up a slaughter house in Tripura. "Particular attention should be kept that hygienic conditions are being maintained within the licensed premises," court further added.

5.title: Police exhume body of Bengal student leader Anish Khan for 2nd post-mortem
5.article_body: West Bengal Police on Monday exhumed the body of student leader Anish Khan for a second post-mortem, nine days after the 28-year-old was allegedly murdered by men dressed in police uniform in Howrah. The Calcutta High Court had on February 24 ordered a second post-mortem amid concerns that the first examination of the body was carried out inaccurately.

6.title: B'luru civic body seeks police support in drive against illegal banners
6.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has sought support from the city police in the drive against illegally installed flexes and banners. "The support of police is needed to take legal action and to prevent any unwanted incident during the drive," BBMP Chief Commissioner Gaurav Gupta said on Monday. City Police Commissioner Kamal Pant has reportedly assured cooperation.

7.title: Pune reports 44 dengue, 270 suspected chikungunya cases in 2 months
7.article_body: The cases of dengue and chikungunya are on rise in Pune as the city reported 44 positive cases of dengue, 270 suspected cases and 24 confirmed cases of chikungunya from January to February 25. "Surge in cases now could be due to various reasons among people who live near water bodies," Dr Sanjeev Wavare, Assistant Health Officer at PMC said.

8.title: High levels of PM2.5 reported in several parts of Bengaluru: Study
8.article_body: High levels of air pollution were recorded in several parts of Bengaluru, a report by Center for Study of Science, Technology and Policy (CSTEP) said. The study used satellite-based products to monitor hotspots, rural-urban contrasts of PM2.5 across Delhi-NCR, Kanpur and Bengaluru in 2019. As per the study, Rajarajeshwari Nagar and South zone recorded highest levels of PM2.5 in Bengaluru.

9.title: We can't abandon ties with Russia or Ukraine: Turkish Prez Erdogan
9.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan said Turkey can't abandon its ties with Russia or Ukraine amid Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. Turkey shares a maritime border with both Ukraine and Russia. Turkey on Sunday had called Russia's invasion a "war", allowing it to invoke parts of an international treaty that will limit the passage of some Russian vessels from Turkish straits.

10.title: Video shows aircraft flying close to Taj Mahal, ASI seeks report from CISF
10.article_body: A video showing an aircraft flying in the no-flying zone of Taj Mahal surfaced on social media on Monday. The 16-second video shows the aircraft flying close to the monument. "We have sought a written report from the CISF officials with regard to the viral video of the aircraft," said Raj Kumar Patel, Superintending Archaeologist of the ASI, Agra Circle.

11.title: Won’t rest till our fellow Indians are safe: Jaishankar amid Ukraine war
11.article_body: Amid the Russia-Ukraine war, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar on Tuesday said that the Centre "will not rest" until the Indians stuck in Ukraine are safe. "We will not rest till our fellow Indians are safe. Ninth Operation Ganga flight departs Bucharest for New Delhi with 218 Indian nationals," Jaishankar tweeted today morning.

12.title: BJP moves Calcutta HC seeking re-elections to 108 civic bodies in WB
12.article_body: BJP has moved Calcutta High Court seeking re-elections to all 108 civic bodies in West Bengal alleging violence during the voting on Sunday. There had been a "complete distortion of law and order", BJP stated in the petition. BJP's West Bengal unit on Sunday wrote to the State Election Commissioner demanding the municipal polls "to be declared null and void".

13.title: J&K people don’t rule themselves, bureaucrats from UP & Guj rule them: Rahul
13.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that today, the people of Jammu and Kashmir don't rule themselves but bureaucrats from UP and Gujarat rule them. "In Punjab, they have unilaterally taken away 100 kms of land and gave it to BSF. Our vision is unity in diversity while theirs is unity through conformity," Gandhi added.

14.title: DND-sector 12/22 route to be made signal free with help of 5 U-turns
14.article_body: Noida authority's traffic cell has started work to make route from the DND flyway to sector 12/22 signal free. Officials said U-turns will be made at five locations along route. "Work for U-turn in front of petrol pump located in Sector 21A has begun...U-turns will be made at five more intersections where currently traffic signals are located," an official said.

15.title: Building contractor kidnapped, shot at by 3 bike-borne men in Ludhiana
15.article_body: A building contractor was kidnapped by three bike-borne men from a market in Ludhiana. They took control of his car at gunpoint and forcefully drove towards Jhande village, where they threw him out of his car. When he resisted and caught hold of one of them, they shot him and fled. A passerby rushed him to a hospital.

16.title: UK oil giant Shell to exit all joint ventures with Russia's Gazprom
16.article_body: British oil giant Shell will exit all its joint ventures with Russian government-controlled energy company Gazprom and related entities. Its assets in these ventures are worth about $3 billion. Shell will also stop working on the Nord Stream 2 pipeline project. Describing Russia's actions in Ukraine as "a senseless act of military aggression", Shell said, "We will not stand by."

17.title: Manipur Congress candidate arrested over violence at polling booth
17.article_body: Congress candidate Dr Lamtinthang Haokip, who is contesting from Manipur's Saitu seat, was arrested on Monday for allegedly causing violence at a polling booth. Haokip has been accused of carrying lethal weapons to the booth and destroying EVM and other equipment. The security personnel reportedly had to resort to firing in the air to disperse the mob.

18.title: Signal calls hacking rumours false, sees rise in East Europe usage
18.article_body: Messaging platform Signal has said that the messages saying that its platform has been "compromised and hacked" is false. Signal said the rumours are part of a coordinated misinformation campaign "meant to encourage people to use less secure alternatives". Signal said it saw an uptick in usage in Eastern Europe in the backdrop of Russia's Ukraine invasion.

19.title: Noida man arrested for posing as magazine editor, blackmailing woman
19.article_body: Delhi Police arrested a 33-year-old Noida man for posing as a Russian magazine editor and harassing women after convincing them to share private photos. The accused Mohit Sharma allegedly approached a woman online and asked her to share private photos on pretext of using them in magazine. Sharma allegedly threatened her to upload them online if she didn't share more.

20.title: Truck carrying LPG cylinders rams into shanty in Ludhiana; 2 injured
20.article_body: Two people suffered minor injuries after a truck laden with LPG cylinders rammed into a shanty near Ludhiana's Pakhowal Road flyover on Monday. The incident took place after the truck hit a wall near the flyover. Police have seized the truck and the reason behind the mishap is being investigated.

21.title: My son has no idea about the negative things going on in my marriage: Nisha
21.article_body: Actress Nisha Rawal spoke to Karanvir Bohra about the domestic violence incident that allegedly broke her and her estranged husband Karan Mehra's marriage. She revealed that her son Kavish does not have any idea about the "negative things" going on in their marriage. Nisha said whenever her son talks about his father, she makes sure to embrace him.

22.title: How much prize money has new world no. 1 Russia's Medvedev won in his tennis career?
22.article_body: Russia's Daniil Medvedev on Monday became the new world number one men's tennis player, overtaking Novak Djokovic. The 26-year-old had turned pro in 2014 and he has won 13 titles so far, including one Grand Slam. In 2022, he has won a prize money of $1,713,615. Overall, Medvedev has won a prize money of $23,350,971 in his career.

23.title: US expels 12 Russian UN diplomats, citing 'espionage activities'
23.article_body: The US has expelled 12 members of Russia's UN mission from America for being "intelligence operatives". The US mission to the UN said diplomats had been "engaging in espionage activities that are adverse to our national security". The expulsions have been "in development for several months" and are in accordance with the US' agreement with the UN, the mission said.

24.title: SBI stops handling trade with sanctioned Russian entities: Report
24.article_body: India's largest lender State Bank of India won't process any transactions involving Russian entities that have been sanctioned after the invasion of Ukraine, Reuters reported citing a letter. "Transactions involving entities, banks, ports or vessels appearing" on a US, European Union or United Nations sanctions list won't be processed irrespective of the currency used, SBI told certain clients.

25.title: India reports 6,915 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate falls below 1%
25.article_body: India has reported 6,915 new COVID-19 cases and 180 deaths in the last 24 hours. Out of the 180 deaths, 99 deaths occurred during the day in the country while 20 were reconciled deaths in Goa and 61 in Kerala, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The daily positivity rate went down from 1.11% to 0.77%.

26.title: Chhattisgarh govt to buy cattle urine from owners to 'augment income'
26.article_body: Chhattisgarh government is making plans to procure cattle urine from cattle owners. Officials said this would augment their income and will lead to "better cow protection". "Cattle urine will be procured in same manner as cow dung...We will procure cattle urine through Gram Gauthan (cattle shed) Samiti...fortnightly payments will be made to cattle owners, farmers," advisor to Chief Minister said.

27.title: 19-yr-old who tracked Musk's jet creates Twitter account to track Russian billionaires
27.article_body: Jack Sweeney, the 19-year-old college student, who tracked Elon Musk's private jet, has now created a Twitter account to track aircraft of Russia's billionaires as they come under international pressure over the country's invasion of Ukraine. "The aircrafts these oligarchs have are absolutely crazy. Their planes are huge compared to other jets," Sweeney told Bloomberg.

28.title: Earlier heroines in their 30s played mothers of some heroes: Lara
28.article_body: Actress Lara Dutta said there was a time when women over 30s were considered for the role of "mothers" of some heroes. She added that now, age-appropriate roles are being written in the industry. "If [heroines] were over 55, [they]...[played] grandmother...or [played] the long-suffering wife," Lara said. "The entire cohort of women between 35 and 55 were...rarely seen," she said.

29.title: 3, including juvenile, held for killing man in Delhi's Jamia Nagar
29.article_body: Three people, including a juvenile, were arrested for allegedly killing a 25-year-old man in Jamia Nagar, police said. The incident took place on Friday following a fight over playing 'gilli danda'. In a video, recorded by the locals, a group was purportedly seen assaulting the victim with sticks. The victim succumbed to his injuries while getting treated at a hospital.

30.title: Police catches 38-yr-old man, minor with pistol & knife at checkpoint in Surat
30.article_body: A 38-year-old man was arrested and a 16-year-old boy was sent to a juvenile home after police in Surat recovered a country-made pistol and a knife from the minor’s bag at a vehicle checking point. They were travelling on a two-wheeler when the police stopped them at Soham circle in the Khatodara area.

31.title: Congress acts like it is Muslims' kin: K’taka minister Eshwarappa
31.article_body: Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa said the Congress acts like they are "relatives of the Muslims". "We (BJP) are for Hindus but Congress cannot even say we are for Muslims. The Congress acts like they are relatives of the Muslims," Eshwarappa added. He had earlier said that Bajrang Dal activist, Harsha, was killed by "Musalmaan goondas" (Muslim goons).

32.title: Bengaluru street art festival Chitra Santhe to be held on March 27
32.article_body: The 19th edition of the popular Bengaluru street art festival, Chitra Santhe, will be held on March 27. The theme of the event will be devoted to the freedom fighters as India celebrates the 75th anniversary of Independence. The Karnataka Chitrakala Parishath, which organises the festival, expects around 1,500 artists from across the country to participate.

33.title: Man and his mother make wife drink floor cleaner in Pune, booked
33.article_body: Pune Police on Monday booked a man and his mother for the attempted murder of his wife by making her drink floor cleaner at their house in Hadapsar area. The incident had allegedly taken place on February 12, police said. The in-laws were demanding ₹2 lakh from her parents to pay EMI of a home loan, the victim said.

34.title: It was a huge hit but I didn't have money for rent after it: Ronit on 'Jaan...'
34.article_body: Actor Ronit Roy said that his debut film 'Jaan Tere Naam' was a huge hit but "stardom was elusive". "I didn't even have money to pay rent even after the film...post the release and hit at the box office, there was no call, no phone, no flowers, no reaction from the industry for three weeks," Ronit said.

35.title: Int'l Ice Hockey Federation bans Russia, Belarus 'until further notice'
35.article_body: The International Ice Hockey Federation (IIHF) has suspended Russian and Belarusian teams from its competitions "until further notice" and has stripped Russia of the 2023 World Junior Championship hosting rights over its invasion of Ukraine. "We were incredibly shocked to see the images that have come out of Ukraine," IIHF President Luc Tardif said in a statement.

36.title: Over 1 lakh Covishield vaccine doses set to expire in Pune by March
36.article_body: Over one lakh doses of Covishield vaccine across 51 private vaccination centres in Pune are set to expire by March, said Dr Sanjay Patil, Chairman of IMA Hospital Board of India, Pune chapter. States/UTs were asked to consider exchange of near expiry vaccine vials by the Centre but Maharashtra has ruled out an exchange of the doses, Dr Patil claimed.

37.title: Australian cricketer Agar's wife receives death threat for husband ahead of Pak series
37.article_body: Australian cricketer Ashton Agar's wife Madeleine received a death threat for her husband on social media ahead of the Pakistan series. "This is a warning for your husband Ashton Agar if he comes to tour against Pakistan he won’t come [back] alive," part of the message read. Officials have said that it doesn't seem to be a credible threat.

38.title: CISF personnel rescues 9-yr-old girl stuck on narrow ledge at Delhi metro station
38.article_body: A nine-year-old girl was rescued by a CISF personnel after she got trapped behind a grill on a narrow ledge at the Nirman Vihar metro station in Delhi. Officers said the girl was playing around the stairs and jumped towards another side, but got stuck on the ledge around 15-20 feet above the ground.

39.title: Netflix not to add govt-run channels to Russian service, defying law
39.article_body: Netflix has refused to add government-run channels to its Russian service, despite a regulation that would require it to distribute them, amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "Given the current situation, we have no plans to add these channels to our service," Netflix said. The regulation requires audiovisual services with more than 1,00,000 subscribers to distribute 20 free-to-air channels.

40.title: Bengaluru to face water supply disruption on March 3
40.article_body: Several parts of Bengaluru will face disruption in water supply on March 3 as authorities will carry out pipeline-linking work across the city. The disruption will continue from 6 am to midnight. The Bangalore Water Supply and Sewerage Board said that a 1,350 mm pipeline from Cauvery near Gubbalala will be linked to 18 million litre capacity reservoir in Banashankari.

41.title: You treat founders as slaves, cut us down at will: Ashneer to BharatPe investors
41.article_body: In his letter of resignation as BharatPe MD, Co-founder Ashneer Grover alleged that the company's investors and board treat founders as "slaves", pushing "us to build multi-billion-dollar businesses and cutting us down at will". "Today I'm being vilified and treated in the most disgraceful manner...I cease to be a human for you (investors)," he added.

42.title: 5-yr-old boy dead, 3 injured as balcony of shopping centre collapses in Mumbai
42.article_body: A five-year-old boy died and three others were injured after a portion of a balcony of a shopping centre collapsed in the Kurla West area of Mumbai on Monday afternoon, an official said. The incident took place on Ram Manohar Lohia Marg at a two-storey structure, he added. The injured persons are currently undergoing treatment.

43.title: It's unfair: Bhagyashree's daughter on being compared to Ananya & Janhvi
43.article_body: Speaking about being compared to actresses Ananya Kapoor and Janhvi Kapoor, actress Bhagyashree's daughter Avantika Dassani, who starred in show 'Mithya', said the comparison isn't fair. "I don't think there should be a comparison," she added. "You should look at every artist for the work they do and their performance. We shouldn't be comparing artists with each other," Avantika said.

44.title: No one from my family was at my wedding, parents didn't agree: Bhagyashree
44.article_body: Actress Bhagyashree said that no one from her family was present at her wedding with husband Himalay Dassani. "And same was the case with my husband. When I told my parents that I want to get married to him, they didn't agree," she said, adding, "Parents should allow the kids to live their dreams."

45.title: India abstains from voting at United Nations Human Rights Council on Ukraine crisis
45.article_body: India was among the 13 countries that abstained from voting at the United Nations Human Rights Council session to hold an urgent debate on Ukraine crisis. Ukraine said Russia was attempting to sow panic among the population by specifically targeting kindergartens, orphanages and hospitals. The vote was passed by 29 out of the Council's 47 members voting in favour.

46.title: Canada bans crude oil imports from Russia amid Ukraine invasion
46.article_body: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau has announced a ban on imports of crude oil from Russia in response to Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The oil revenues have "benefited Russian President Vladimir Putin and his oligarchs greatly", Trudeau said. "Even though Canada has barely imported any Russian oil and gas in recent years, this move sends a powerful message," he added.

47.title: Will be disappointing to have no crowd: Gavaskar on Kohli's 100th Test
47.article_body: Former India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said it'll be disappointing to have no crowd for the first Test against Sri Lanka, which is also slated to be ex-captain Virat Kohli's 100th Test. "The 100th Test is very very special...but I think the decision has been taken in the greater interest," Gavaskar added. Kohli has scored 7,962 runs in 99 Tests.

48.title: 64-km-long Russian convoy nears Ukraine's Kyiv, pics surface
48.article_body: Satellite pictures showing a Russian military convoy stretching for around 64 km nearing Ukrainian capital of Kyiv have surfaced online. The convoy is substantially longer than the 27 km reported earlier, Maxar Technologies said. The company also said additional ground forces deployments and ground attack helicopter units were seen in southern Belarus, less than 32 km north of Ukraine border.

49.title: Elon Musk sends Starlink satellite internet terminals to Ukraine, Vice PM shares pic
49.article_body: Ukraine Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov took to Twitter to reveal that SpaceX Starlink satellite internet terminals have arrived in Ukraine amid war with Russia. "Starlink - here. Thanks, @elonmusk," he wrote. He also shared a picture of a vehicle carrying the terminals. Fedorov had asked SpaceX CEO Elon Musk for assistance on Saturday.

50.title: Delhi government reduces COVID-19 beds as cases fall
50.article_body: Delhi government has started reducing COVID-19 beds in hospitals as cases have started declining. The number of COVID-19 beds on February 24 stood at 15,294, and it was reduced to 11,089 on February 27. "We had made arrangements to increase the beds up to 1,00,000 if the need arose," an official said. COVID-19 bed occupancy on February 27 was 1.62%.

51.title: BMC to install new bus shelters with movable benches in Mumbai's suburbs
51.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation has decided to refurbish and install new bus shelters at 105 locations in Mumbai's suburban belt. New shelters will have movable metal benches clamped on footpath. The benches will have a transparent enclosure which will help with visibility for the passengers. Officials said that the new shelters will consume less space and will be visually appealing.

52.title: Russia used vacuum bomb during invasion: Ukraine ambassador to US
52.article_body: Oksana Markarova, Ukraine's ambassador to the US, told reporters that Russia had used a thermobaric weapon, known as a vacuum bomb, in its invasion of her country. "The devastation that Russia is trying to inflict on Ukraine is large," she said. There has been no official confirmation that thermobaric weapon has been used in the conflict in Ukraine.

53.title: Ashneer Grover quits as BharatPe MD, says 'I'm being forced to bid adieu'
53.article_body: BharatPe's Ashneer Grover, who's in a tussle with the board over a governance review, has resigned as MD and director. In his letter, Ashneer said, "I write this with a heavy heart as...I'm being forced to bid adieu to a company of which I'm a Founder." Earlier, his wife Madhuri was fired as Head of Controls on funds misappropriation allegations.

54.title: 4 alleged media persons extort money from woman in Ujjain, booked
54.article_body: Four alleged media persons have been booked for extorting money and valuables from a woman in Ujjain, Madhya Pradesh. The accused, who're all on the run, have been identified as Shubham Bamne, Pooja Solanki, Dharmendra Parmar and Omprakash Pal. The group had allegedly extorted cash and other items from a house after receiving information about a sex racket running there.

55.title: Duo posing as police flee with man's gold chain in Powai, booked
55.article_body: Two persons have been booked for cheating a senior citizen in Powai by posing as police and running away with his gold chain. The duo had caught the 60-year-old retired BMP employee without a mask and questioned him before fleeing with his chain worth ₹45,000 on Sunday morning. A case was registered under relevant sections of the Indian Penal Code.

56.title: Viral magazine covers showing Putin with Nazi symbol, Hitler moustache are fake
56.article_body: Two photoshopped images purporting to show Russian President Vladimir Putin as German dictator Adolf Hitler on the cover of TIME magazine, have been going viral online, amid Russian invasion of Ukraine. One of the covers features Hitler's eyes merged with Putin's face with a swastika. The other one shows Hitler's iconic toothbrush moustache on Putin's face.

57.title: Ukrainian soldiers who told Russian warship 'go f*** yourself' are alive: Navy
57.article_body:
A group of 13 Ukrainian soldiers thought to have died while defending an island in the Black Sea after telling a Russian warship to “go f*** yourself”, are alive and well, confirmed the Ukrainian navy. 
However, they have been illegally captured by the Russians, it added. They were thought to have been among the first victims of the Russian invasion.

58.title: PMC to construct 100 MT solid waste management plant in Pune
58.article_body: A solid waste management project is to be set up at a ten-acre independent plot of Cantonment Board located in Pune's Hadapsar Industrial Estate. The project has been approved by the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) for a cost of ₹20 crore. Out of the total, ₹7.50 crore have been sanctioned for constructing a 100 metric tonne processing plant.

59.title: FIFA & UEFA suspend Russia from all international football competitions
59.article_body: FIFA and UEFA have suspended Russian teams from international football competitions "until further notice" amid its invasion of Ukraine. The FIFA World Cup was scheduled to be held in Qatar later this year. UEFA will also cancel its sponsorship deal with the Russian gas company, Gazprom. "Football is in full solidarity with...the people affected in Ukraine," read their statement.

60.title: Defeat BJP to get rid of inflation: Chhattisgarh CM
60.article_body: Ahead of the sixth phase of the Uttar Pradesh elections, Chhattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel on Monday urged the people of the state to defeat BJP to get rid of inflation. While addressing a gathering in UP's Sardarnagar area, he said, "The rates of diesel and petrol will skyrocket after the elections are over." He added, "Mehengai hatao, bhajpa harao."

61.title: NCP, Cong protest against Maha Guv's remarks on Shivaji Maharaj
61.article_body: The NCP and Congress on Monday held agitations in Pune to protest against the remarks made by Maharashtra governor Bhagat Singh Koshyari in Aurangabad. Koshyari, while speaking on importance of teachers, had allegedly stated that Samarth Ramdas was the guru of Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj. Meanwhile, BJP MP Udayanraje Bhonsle, who is a descendent of Shivaji, also criticised the statement.

62.title: Delhi reports 258 COVID-19 cases & zero deaths in last 24 hrs
62.article_body: Delhi reported 258 new COVID-19 cases and no related death in the last 24 hours, taking the overall infection tally in the city to 18,59,892. Moreover, 499 recoveries were reported in the national capital, with the city currently having 1,845 active cases. With no death in the last 24 hours, the fatality count in Delhi remains at 26,122.

63.title: Bureaucrats from UP & Guj rule people of J&K today: Rahul Gandhi
63.article_body: While addressing a gathering in Chennai, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that bureaucrats from Uttar Pradesh and Gujarat rule the people of Jammu and Kashmir today. He further said, "In Punjab, they unilaterally took away 100 km of land and gave it to the Border Security Force (BSF)." Gandhi added that Congress' vision is "unity in diversity."

64.title: Akhilesh protected, embraced terrorists as CM of UP: JP Nadda
64.article_body: While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Mirzapur, BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda said that Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav 'protected and embraced terrorists' during his tenure as the Chief Minister of UP. Nadda said that BJP has taken strict measures against such elements after 2017. There's a rule of law in UP now, he further added.

65.title: Policeman attacked by suspected militants in J&K's Srinagar
65.article_body: A police inspector was attacked by suspected militants in the Batamaloo area of J&K's Srinagar on Monday, police said. The policeman, identified as Sheikh Firdous, was returning from a local mosque after offering prayers when he was fired upon, police added. He is currently undergoing treatment at a hospital and his condition is said to be stable.

66.title: 28 more Bihar students return from Ukraine on Monday
66.article_body: Twenty-eight more students from Bihar arrived in Patna on Monday from Ukraine, just a day after 23 students from the state returned home. According to Patna district administration officials, the students arrived in three batches. Patna district magistrate Dr Chandrashekhar Singh said all returnees were provided free of cost vehicles to transport them to their respective native places.

67.title: PM running 'Mission Ganga', Akhilesh ran 'Mission Dangas': MP CM
67.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan while addressing a rally in Jaunpur on Monday, claimed that "700 riots" took place in UP during Akhilesh Yadav's rule. Further describing the Samajwadi Party chief as "Dangesh" he said, "PM Modi running 'Mission Ganga' (to evacuate Indians from Ukraine) while Akhilesh ran 'Mission Dangas' (riots)." Chouhan had earlier compared Akhilesh to Aurangzeb.

68.title: UN Security Council imposes arms embargo on Yemen's Houthi rebels
68.article_body: UN Security Council on Monday imposed an arms embargo on Iran-backed Houthi rebel groups of Yemen. Proposed by UAE, the measure expands a targeted embargo on several Houthi leaders to the whole group. This comes after the group claimed multiple drone and missile attacks in UAE and Saudi Arabia this year. With 11 votes in favour, the resolution was passed.

69.title: Burman family makes offer to buy additional 26% stake in Eveready
69.article_body: Eveready's single-largest investor Burman family on Monday said it made an open offer to buy an additional 26% stake, or 18.9 million shares, for ₹604.76 crore in Eveready Industries Ltd. The mandatory open offer under the takeover regulations was made as the Burmans acquired an additional 5.26% share of Eveready for ₹122.30 crore, taking their total shareholding to 25.11%.

70.title: My soulmate left me today: Chef Vikas Khanna shares post after sister's death
70.article_body: Chef Vikas Khanna on Monday shared a post to mourn the death of his sister, Radhika Khanna. Sharing a photo, Khanna wrote, "My soulmate left me today...She fought like a champion for years with Lupus, aHUS, renal failure. But today due to multiple organ failures, my best friend passed away in my arms. Loveeeee you Radha forever & forever. RIP."

71.title: In a policy shift, Finland to send weapons to Ukraine amid invasion
71.article_body: Finland will send weapons and ammunition to Ukraine amid ongoing Russian military offensive, PM Sanna Marin said on Monday. The shipment will include 2,500 assault rifles,1,50,000 bullets, 1,500 anti-tank weapons and 70,000 food packages, Defence Minister Antti Kaikkonen said. The decision comes as a policy shift for Finland which has remained militarily neutral since end of World War II.

72.title: Very unusual of him: Gavaskar on Rohit's dismissal in 3rd T20I vs SL
72.article_body: Referring to captain Rohit Sharma's dismissal in third T20I against Sri Lanka, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said it was "a strange and completely uncharacteristic innings" right from the first ball. "He was looking to play on the onside maybe. He's very disappointed...in this occasion, Rohit was looking to hit every ball, which is unusual," Gavaskar added. Rohit scored nine-ball five.

73.title: 600 CCTVs placed at Chandni Chowk to check encroachment: Police
73.article_body: Over 600 CCTVs have been installed at Chandni Chowk to monitor illegal vendors, Delhi Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana told the Delhi High Court on Monday. He also said that a control room would monitor the feed 24 hours every day. He further said that they would install similar cameras under Safe City Project in Delhi in the future.

74.title: UP no longer wants to be driven by casteism: PM at Ballia rally
74.article_body: PM Narendra Modi arrived in Ballia on Monday to address voters and spoke about people rejecting "dynasty politics". He further said, "[The] vehicle of UP is no longer going to get stuck in...streets of caste as it has gained momentum on...highway of development." He added he has an "emotional connect" with Ballia as the Ujjwala scheme was launched from there.

75.title: Serena Williams: Sharapova on her toughest opponent
75.article_body: Terming Serena Williams as toughest competitor she's ever faced, ex-world number one Maria Sharapova said the 23-time Grand Slam champion was the most challenging and consistent in her level. Serena has a 20-2 career record over Sharapova. She won the last 19 meetings in a row. Notably, it's the longest active winning streak over a single player on WTA Tour.

76.title: TRS leader Sajid Khan, booked for raping 15-yr-old girl, expelled
76.article_body: Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) leader Sheikh Sajid Khan, who's on the run after being accused of rape by a 15-year-old girl, has been expelled from the party. The announcement was made by TRS on Monday, just a day after police registered a sexual assault case against Khan. Police said they're searching for him and shall "arrest him at the earliest".

77.title: EU to hold summit with China on April 1 to defuse tensions: Official
77.article_body: European Commission Vice-President Valdis Dombrovskis on Monday said that the European Union (EU) will hold a summit with China on April 1 in an attempt to defuse growing tensions between the two. "We know we're in a complicated phase of relations with China," he added. Notably, the EU regards China as a strategic rival in some fields, according to Reuters.

78.title: Students from TN, T'gana & K'taka stuck in Ukraine break down, seek help
78.article_body: Videos of Indian students stranded in Ukraine are circulating on social media. The students, reportedly from Tamil Nadu, Telangana and Karnataka can be seen breaking down on camera while describing their condition. In one of the videos, some Tamil Nadu students can be seen pleading with the government to evacuate them while talking about "acute shortage of food and water".

79.title: Nuclear conflict inconceivable: UN chief on Russia-Ukraine conflict
79.article_body: Speaking at the emergency session of the United Nations General Assembly over the Russia-Ukraine conflict on Monday, UN Secretary-General António Guterres said, "The mere idea of a nuclear conflict is simply inconceivable." Notably, Guterres was speaking in reference to Russia putting its nuclear deterrent forces on high alert amid the conflict. Guterres also called it a "chilling development".

80.title: It's a lovely journey, we are growing: Dulquer on wife Amal
80.article_body: Actor Dulquer Salmaan has said it has been a lovely journey with his wife Amal Sufiya and they both are growing and learning about each other. "I completed 10 years in the industry and...10 years of marriage as well," he said. "It's about realising what keeps you together, what you want in your life together," he added.

81.title: Pop artiste Rose tests positive for COVID-19, cancels some tours
81.article_body: Pop artiste Rose, part of the South Korean pop group Blackpink, has tested positive for COVID-19, the label handling the group said in a statement on Monday. "As a result, some of her overseas schedules have been cancelled," the statement said. Rose was to travel overseas for her tour this week.

82.title: Rock band Green Day cancels Moscow concert over Ukraine crisis
82.article_body: American rock band Green Day has decided to cancel its upcoming concert in Moscow in the wake of Russia's military operation in Ukraine. "We are aware that this moment is not about stadium rock shows, it's much bigger than that...Refunds available at the point of purchase," the band said in a statement. The concert was earlier scheduled for May 29.

83.title: Man flees after attempting to rape 7-yr-old girl in Ludhiana; booked
83.article_body: A man has been booked for attempting to rape a seven-year-old girl in Ludhiana. The incident took place on February 23 in Rasulpur village in Jagraon, following which the accused ran away from the scene. The victim's father, who lodged a complaint with police, said he had found the man trying to undress the minor while in an inebriated condition.

84.title: Russia's Medvedev replaces Djokovic as world number one men's tennis player
84.article_body: Russia's Daniil Medvedev has officially replaced Novak Djokovic as world number one men's tennis player. Medvedev is the third Russian to become world number one men's tennis player after Yevgeny Kafelnikov and Marat Safin. The 6-foot-6-inch tall player is the tallest men's player to become world number one in the history of ATP rankings.

85.title: Will Smith, Jessica Chastain win best actor awards at SAG Awards 2022
85.article_body: Actors Will Smith and Jessica Chastain were awarded Outstanding Performance by a Male and Female Actor in a Leading Role respectively at the SAG Awards 2022. Will won for his performance in 'King Richard' while Jessica was awarded for her role in 'The Eyes of Tammy Faye'. The film 'CODA' won Outstanding Performance by a Cast in a Motion Picture.

86.title: Lee Jung Jae, Jung Ho Yeon win SAG Awards 2022 for 'Squid Game'
86.article_body: Actor Lee Jung Jae has won the award for Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Drama Series for 'Squid Game' at the SAG Awards 2022. Actress Jung Ho Yeon received the Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Drama Series. The South Korean series also won in the Outstanding Action Performance as a Stunt Ensemble category.

87.title: It's truly awful: Brian Cox on Russia's invasion of Ukraine
87.article_body: At the Screen Actors Guild Awards 2022, 'Succession' actor Brian Cox termed Russian invasion of Ukraine as "truly awful". "It's particularly awful in terms of [how] it's affecting people, particularly in our profession," he said. "But the thing that really distressed me is what's happening in Russia to my fellow actors...they cannot say a word about Ukraine," Brian added.

88.title: We came with mindset to enjoy every moment: Wiese on PSL win
88.article_body: Lahore Qalandars all-rounder David Wiese said his side came with a mindset of enjoying every moment in Pakistan Super League (PSL) final after winning their maiden title with a 42-run victory against Multan Sultans on Sunday. "We had beaten Multan before in the tournament and we took confidence from that, but also it's a final...anything can happen," he added.

89.title: Centre committed towards development of North-East: Union Minister
89.article_body: Union Minister of Jal Shakti Gajendra Singh Shekhawat on Monday said that the Centre is committed to the development of the North-Eastern region. While addressing the conference of State Ministers of North-Eastern Region on Jal Jeevan Mission (JJM) and Swachh Bharat Mission in Guwahati, he said the state should give emphasis on maintaining quality while implementing JJM in the region.

90.title: Odisha govt bans Holi celebration in public places
90.article_body: The Odisha government on Monday banned the Holi celebration in public places and restricted large gatherings during festivals. "People may celebrate Holi with family members in their houses only," an order issued by the state government said. Local authorities would ensure proper adherence to the COVID-19 appropriate guidelines on Mahashivratri, Holi and Dol Purnima, the order added.

91.title: Indian refuses to leave Ukraine after not being allowed to bring pet dog
91.article_body: Indian engineering student Rishabh Kaushik has refused to leave war-hit Ukraine after being unable to get NOC from the Indian government to bring his pet dog 'Malibu' with him. Kaushik, who's in an underground bunker in Kyiv, rescued the puppy last year. He said he's been in touch with the Indian embassy since February 18 to get the necessary documents.

92.title: TikTok now allows 10-minute-long videos on the app
92.article_body: TikTok has started rolling out the ability that allows users to upload videos that are up to 10 minutes long. TikTok, which began as a 15-second video app, has been gradually increasing the maximum time limit for videos and last increased the limit to 3 minutes in July 2021. Owned by Chinese internet conglomerate ByteDance, TikTok remains banned in India.

93.title: Govt must share evacuation plan with Indians in Ukraine: Rahul
93.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday said that the Centre must urgently share the detailed evacuation plan with Indians stranded in Ukraine, as well as with their families. Referring to a video in which the Ukrainian Army can be seen using force against the Indian students, he said, "We can't abandon our own people. No parent should go through this."

94.title: Man steals motorcycle during test ride in Punjab's Ludhiana
94.article_body: A man pretending to buy a second-hand motorcycle stole it during a test ride in Punjab's Ludhiana. The complainant, who owned the bike, Yamaha R15, had posted an advertisement on a social networking site. The accused came to his house and asked him to go for a test ride first, but he did not return.

95.title: I've made many mistakes in my life, have been misunderstood: Poonam
95.article_body: Actor-model Poonam Pandey has said that she's not controversial at all in real life. While interacting with 'Lock Upp' host Kangana Ranaut in the first episode, Poonam said, "I am a normal person...I have made a lot of mistakes in my life...I have been misunderstood." Actress Nisha Rawal and comedian Munawar Faruqui are among the other contestants in the show.

96.title: Biden to host ASEAN leaders for summit in March in US: White House
96.article_body: The White House on Monday said that President Joe Biden will host the leaders of the Association of Southeast Asian Nations (ASEAN) for a special summit in the US from March 28-29. "It's a top priority for the Biden-Harris Administration to serve as a...reliable partner...to...ASEAN," it added. Notably, the summit was announced amid growing concerns about China in the US.

97.title: 'Putin forcing us to lie,' reads message on Russian media sites after hack
97.article_body: Several Russian media outlets, including state-owned TASS, were hacked on Monday. An anti-war message was posted on the homepage of these websites, with calls to stop Russian President Vladimir Putin's invasion of Ukraine. "Dear citizens. We urge you to stop this madness, don't send your sons and husbands to certain death. Putin is forcing us to lie," the message read.

98.title: Solanki to continue playing Ranji despite losing daughter, dad in span of 2 weeks
98.article_body: Baroda batter Vishnu Solanki has decided to carry on playing Ranji Trophy despite losing his father and one-day-old daughter in a span of two weeks. Solanki lost his daughter on February 12. He returned to the team on February 17 and scored a hundred on February 25. He would feature in Baroda's next match despite losing his father on Sunday.

99.title: 10 Assam students evacuated from Ukraine, state opens helplines
99.article_body: Ten students from Assam who were stranded in war-torn Ukraine have been evacuated along with other Indians, the state government said. Two of the 10 students who have been evacuated arrived in Mumbai, and the others in New Delhi. Meanwhile, the Assam Police issued helpline numbers +91 6026900968 and +91 6026901060 (both WhatsApp) for assistance.

100.title: Will not allow weapons for Ukraine to transit our territory: Hungary
100.article_body: Hungarian Foreign Minister Péter Szijjártó on Monday said that Hungary will not send troops or weapons to Ukraine and will not allow lethal weapons to transit its territory in order to keep the country safe. "The reason...is that such deliveries might become targets of hostile military action," he added. "We are not getting involved in that war," he further said.

101.title: President Zelenskyy signs application for Ukraine to join European Union
101.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday signed an application for Ukraine to join the European Union. Earlier today, Zelenskyy had urged the EU to allow Ukraine to gain membership under a special procedure immediately amid the Russian invasion. "Our goal is to be with all Europeans and, most importantly, to be equal...I am sure we deserve it," he said.

102.title: Hearing good things about Bobby's performance in Love Hostel: Salman
102.article_body: Actor Salman Khan took to Instagram and said that he's hearing good things about actor Bobby Deol's performance in the film 'Love Hostel'. "Best wishes always and hope you keep doing better and better," Salman further wrote. Bobby and Salman worked together in the 2018 film 'Race 3'. Actors Vikrant Massey and Sanya Malhotra also feature in 'Love Hostel'.

103.title: Remarkable feat: Babar on Shaheen-led Lahore Qalandars winning 1st PSL title
103.article_body: Following Lahore Qalandars' maiden Pakistan Super League (PSL) title win, Pakistan captain Babar Azam congratulated them, saying it's a "remarkable feat" achieved by captain Shaheen Shah Afridi. "Amazing display of performance by both teams...I want to thank the fans for making PSL a hit!" he tweeted. Chasing a 181-run target, Multan Sultans were bowled out for 138 in 19.3 overs.

104.title: Out for a swim, 3 teens drown in stream in Andhra's Prakasam
104.article_body: Three teenagers, who went for a swim in a stream, drowned in Andhra Pradesh's Prakasam district, the police said on Monday. "Apparently, they did not gauge the depth of the stream, which was about 10 feet, and drowned within minutes," Tangutur Sub-Inspector Khadar Basha said. The bodies have been shifted to a local government hospital for a post-mortem examination.

105.title: Condition of Indian students pathetic: MP girl stuck in Ukraine
105.article_body: A student of Sumy State Medical University in Ukraine, Ishika Sarkar, who hails from Madhya Pradesh, sought help from the government of India, stating that the condition of Indian students in Ukraine has "become very pathetic". "They are spending time in bunkers in a very pathetic condition. Soon there will be crises of food, electricity and mobile network," she said.

106.title: Landslide in U'khand's Rudraprayag, families taken to safer areas
106.article_body: A landslide occurred in the hilly Jhalimath village in Uttarakhand's Rudraprayag on Monday. Several cowsheds and toilets were damaged in the incident, prompting the administration to shift 11 families to safer places. A chunk of the slope beneath the village slid several hundred metres down to the banks of the Alaknanda river, District Disaster Management Officer Nandan Singh said.

107.title: I'm praying for the people in Ukraine: Actress Angelina Jolie
107.article_body: After Russia invaded Ukraine on Thursday, Hollywood actress Angelina Jolie took to Instagram and wrote that she is praying for the people in Ukraine. "My focus along with my UNHCR colleagues is that everything possible is done to ensure the protection and basic human rights of those displaced, and refugees in the region," she added.

108.title: Poland-Lithuania gas link to open earlier amid Russia supply worries
108.article_body: A natural gas pipeline linking Poland and Lithuania is set to open on May 1, earlier than its scheduled start. The GIPL pipeline's inaugural was preponed due to concerns of disrupted Russian gas supply to Europe, following its invasion of Ukraine. Europe is dependent on Russia for over 35% of its natural gas, most of which is transported via pipelines.

109.title: Shaheen you're a champion: Shahid on Lahore Qalandars' PSL title win
109.article_body: Calling Lahore Qalandars captain Shaheen Shah Afridi a "champion" after he led his side to their maiden Pakistan Super League (PSL) title, ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi took to Twitter to congratulate the "amazing" team. "The entire Qalandars squad and in fact, the entire Lahore deserves this! Buhut Mubarak," he wrote. Lahore Qalandars beat Multan Sultans by 42 runs on Sunday.

110.title: Russia bans residents from transferring money abroad from March 1
110.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has ordered a ban on foreign exchange loans and transfers by its residents to outside of the country from March 1, in response to the economic sanctions imposed by the West. It also prohibits companies from buying back their own stocks. This comes after Russia banned flights from 36 countries in a retaliatory move against EU.

111.title: BJP hatching conspiracy to end reservation: Akhilesh Yadav
111.article_body: While addressing a meeting in the Jalalpur Assembly constituency, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav said, "The BJP is hatching a conspiracy to end reservation, and hence it is selling government organisations to the private sector." He further said the people of Uttar Pradesh have rejected BJP in the first five phases of UP polls.

112.title: I'm a player's captain, now more experienced: KKR skipper Shreyas
112.article_body: Newly-appointed Kolkata Knight Riders skipper Shreyas Iyer said he's a player's captain and wants to create an atmosphere in the team where everyone would be thinking only about winning. "I'm now more mature and experienced in terms of my decision-making and captaincy skills," he added. Shreyas was bought by KKR for ₹12.25 crore in the recent IPL mega auction.

113.title: Russia's economic reality has considerably changed: Russian govt
113.article_body: Speaking about the economic measures taken against Russia by other countries over invasion of Ukraine, the Russian government said, "The economic reality has considerably changed." "These are heavy sanctions...but Russia has the potential to offset the harm," it added. Russia has been making plans for quite a long time for possible sanctions, including the most severe ones, it further said.

114.title: 'Europeans with blue eyes, blonde hair being killed', says Ukraine official; criticised
114.article_body: While talking about the current Russia-Ukraine conflict, Ukraine's Deputy Chief Prosecutor David Sakvarelidze said, "It's really emotional for me because I see European people with blue eyes and blonde hair being killed...with (Russian President) Vladimir Putin's missiles." Sakvarelidze has been criticised for the statement with many calling it 'racist' and indicative of 'white supremacy'.

115.title: India needs to be powerful in fast-changing world: PM Modi in UP
115.article_body: While addressing voters in UP's Maharajganj, PM Narendra Modi spoke about the need for the country to remain powerful in the fast-changing world. He said, "You're witnessing the situation of a fast-changing world in...last two years. [The] world is going through several challenges....Nobody can remain untouched from this. Under this situation, it's very important for India to be powerful."

116.title: Slovakia sends missiles, rockets to Ukraine amid war with Russia
116.article_body: Slovakian Defence Minister Jaroslav Nad on Monday said Slovakia delivered two batches of supplies worth €15.4 million, including 486 air-defence missiles and anti-tank rockets to Ukraine. This comes as Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24 killing at least 352 civilians including 14 children. Nad added the country also sent 120mm artillery ammunition and fuel.

117.title: Sudan's key pro-democracy groups release 1st political charter
117.article_body: The main pro-democracy groups of Sudan on Sunday released a political charter for the first time, aiming to unify factions and bring democracy. As per charter, an appointed PM will serve as head of state and military commander-in-chief for a transition period of 2 years until a constitution is ratified. Sudan plunged into crisis after military coup in October 2021.

118.title: Estée Lauder fires senior exec Demsey for posting racist meme on Instagram
118.article_body: The Estée Lauder Companies has fired Executive Group President John Demsey for posting a meme on his Instagram account that contained a racial slur and a joke about COVID-19. The company said Demsey's Instagram posts caused "widespread offence". Demsey, who oversees brands like Clinique and Mac, had apologised last week for "carelessly reposting a racist meme without reading it beforehand."

119.title: Heroin worth ₹70 lakh seized in Haryana, 9 arrested
119.article_body: Haryana Police has arrested nine people from Jind and Sirsa districts in separate cases and seized heroin worth around ₹70 lakh from them. Of the total 669 grams seized, 514 grams of heroin was recovered from two of the accused near Belarkhan village. Preliminary probe revealed the drugs were to be supplied in Narwana, Sangrur and Patiala areas, police said.

120.title: Switzerland bans entry of 5 Russian oligarchs close to Putin
120.article_body: Swiss Justice Minister Karin Keller-Sutter on Monday said government banned five Russian oligarchs close to Russian President Vladimir Putin from entering the country. This comes after the neutral nation adopted sanctions imposed by EU against Russia after it mounted a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24. However, the minister did not name the oligarchs citing privacy concerns.

121.title: Filmmaker Luv Ranjan shares first pics of wedding with Alisha
121.article_body: Filmmaker Luv Ranjan on Monday took to social media to share the first pictures of his wedding with his longtime girlfriend Alisha Vaid. The couple got married on February 20 in Agra. Their wedding was attended by actors Kartik Aaryan, Ranbir Kapoor, Shraddha Kapoor, Rakul Preet Singh, Jackky Bhagnani, Arjun Kapoor and Varun Sharma, among others.

122.title: Ukraine to pay its soldiers ₹2.5 lakh per month for fighting Russian troops
122.article_body: Ukraine has announced that its soldiers will be paid 100,000 hryvnias per month (around ₹2.5 lakh) for defending against Russian forces. Families of deceased servicemen will be paid a lump sum amount of 15 million UAH (around ₹3.7 crore). As per the President, this isn't done to be thanked but to tell the defenders that Ukraine is grateful to them.

123.title: Sick, filthy: Gauahar on channel saying she fought with Shibani over Farhan
123.article_body: Gauahar Khan has criticised a news channel for reporting that she fought with Shibani Dandekar over a crush on Farhan Akhtar calling it filthy and sick. "Be...absolutely ashamed that in a time [of] war...some parts of...media...can't stop lying," she tweeted. Gauahar further wrote that she said all contestants of reality show 'I Can Do That' were crushing on host Farhan.

124.title: BSF airlifts 3 patients from J&K's snow-covered Kupwara
124.article_body: Three patients requiring immediate medical attention were airlifted by BSF from J&K's snow-covered Kupwara district on Monday. The Public Relations Officer of Kashmir Frontier said the district administration had made a special request for their evacuation as the only road passing through Sadhna top was closed. "We're always there to serve people of Kashmir," IG of BSF Kashmir said.

125.title: After calling Vikrant 'cockroach', Kangana wishes him on marrying a Himachali
125.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut wished actor Vikrant Massey on marrying Sheetal Thakur on Instagram, commenting, "Hmm Vikrant ji marrying a Himachali girl is good karma. Wish you both a happy married life." She had earlier called Vikrant a 'cockroach' after he commented on actress Yami Gautam's picture dressed in traditional Himachali bridal attire writing, "Pure and pious like Radhe Maa."

126.title: Delhi HC refuses to entertain plea to change title of 'Prithviraj'
126.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday refused to entertain a plea seeking to modify the title of Akshay Kumar-starrer 'Prithviraj'. The bench of judges said that they were inclined to dismiss the plea with costs after which the plea was withdrawn. The submitted plea had stated that Prithviraj was a great emperor and the title should be more respectful.

127.title: Don't feed stray dogs, monkeys on court premises: Delhi High Court
127.article_body: The Delhi High Court on Monday directed advocates, litigants, staff members and security personnel to not feed stray animals like monkeys and dogs within its premises. The court said that it had come to notice that some advocates, litigants, staff members and security personnel were still feeding stray animals in spite of directions issued against it.

128.title: Luxembourg to send anti-tank weapons to Ukraine amid war with Russia
128.article_body: Luxembourg Defence Minister François Bausch on Monday said the government will send 100 NLAW anti-tank weapons, jeeps and 15 military tents to Ukraine. This comes after EU on Sunday decided to fund military weapons for Ukraine to help it defend itself against Russian invasion. At least 352 civilians including 14 children were killed since Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.

129.title: New Zealand to end quarantine curbs for vaccinated arrivals
129.article_body: New Zealand is set to end quarantine curbs for vaccinated nationals returning to the country from Thursday onwards, Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern has said. Incoming travellers will still need to test negative for COVID-19 before leaving and after arriving. The revised rule, however, does not include tourists as New Zealand hasn't opened its borders for international tourism yet.

130.title: Putin is a warmonger, tyrant & also kind of a huge b***h: John Oliver
130.article_body: Talking about Russian President Vladimir Putin, comedian John Oliver said, "He's an autocrat, a tyrant, a warmonger. But also, he's kinda...huge b***h." Oliver's comments were in response to a video of the security meeting where Putin ordered Russia's Foreign Intelligence Service chief Sergei Naryshkin to "speak plainly" on the matter of recognising Donetsk and Luhansk as 'People's Republics'.

131.title: PM Modi chairs 3rd high-level meeting in 24 hours on Russia-Ukraine conflict
131.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held the third high-level meeting within 24 hours on the Russia-Ukraine conflict, on Monday evening. The meeting was attended by External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar along with Union Ministers Jyotiraditya Scindia, Kiren Rijiju, Hardeep Puri and VK Singh. Scindia, Rijiju, Puri and Singh will be sent to Ukraine's neighbouring nations to oversee Indians' evacuation.

132.title: 8 yrs ago, universe did us a solid: Ankita on anniversary with Milind
132.article_body: Taking to Instagram, actor-model Milind Soman's wife Ankita Konwar shared pictures with the actor to mark eight years of togetherness. "On this day, eight years ago, the universe did us a solid and it continues to work its charm every single day," she captioned the post. Milind and Ankita got married in April 2018 after dating for five years.

133.title: Moldova new land route to evacuate Indians stuck in Ukraine: MEA
133.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs on Monday said a new route through Moldova has been identified for evacuation of Indian nationals stranded in Ukraine. MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said the new route is operational and the Ministry's team is ready to assist those in need. "They will assist in the evacuation of Indians through Romania," Bagchi said.

134.title: Let's not politicise the evacuation process: Ex-PM Devegowda
134.article_body: Former Prime Minister HD Devegowda on Monday said the evacuation of Indians stuck in Ukraine must not be politicised. "It will demoralise those conducting the operation. Scoring points at this hour of crisis will make us look bad," Devegowda said. "It is only fair that we support our officers and embassies to focus on the job at hand," he added.

135.title: BJP crossed majority mark in UP after 5 phases of polls: Shah
135.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday claimed the BJP has already gone past the majority mark after the first five phases of polling in the Uttar Pradesh elections. "In the sixth and seventh phases, people have to vote for the BJP to form the government with over 300 seats," he said at an election rally.

136.title: 15 booked after Panchkula trader ends life in Ludhiana hotel
136.article_body: The Ludhiana Police on Sunday booked 15 persons for abetment to suicide after a Panchkula-based trader ended his life over being allegedly harassed by his business associates. Sub-Inspector Jaskanwal Singh Sekhon said the victim was found dead in his hotel room on February 25. The police had found two pills and a suicide note from his room.

137.title: Urgent to end talks to revive Iran nuclear deal this week: France
137.article_body: France's Foreign Ministry on Monday said that it is urgent to end negotiations to revive a 2015 nuclear deal between world powers and Iran this week. The talks are being held in Austria's Vienna. Separately, Iran said that efforts to revive the deal could succeed if the US took a political decision to meet its demands.

138.title: Russian President Putin calls West an 'Empire of Lies' after sanctions
138.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin called the West an "Empire of Lies" following the economic sanctions imposed by countries like the UK and those in EU. "PM Mikhail Mishustin and I discussed this...bearing in mind the sanctions the so-called Western community...as I called it in my speech, the 'empire of lies' - is now trying to implement against Russia," Putin said.

139.title: Don't be aggressive at railway stations: Advisory for Indians stuck in Ukraine
139.article_body: The Indian embassy in Ukraine requested Indian nationals, students stuck amid war to "remain calm, peaceful and united". Warning of large crowds at railway stations, the embassy advisory said, "It's advised that all Indian students remain patient, composed and especially not to exhibit aggressive behaviours while at the railway stations." Delays in trains and cancellations are expected, it added.

140.title: How much prize money did PSL 2022 winners get as compared to IPL 2021?
140.article_body: Pakistan Super League (PSL) 2022 winners Lahore Qalandars won a cash prize of PKR 80,000,000 (around ₹3.4 crore), while Indian Premier League 2021 champions Chennai Super Kings had won ₹20 crore. Further PSL 2022 runners-up Multan Sultans got a cash prize of PKR 32,000,000 (₹1.37 crore), while IPL 2021 runners-up KKR received a prize money of ₹12.5 crore.

141.title: 3-day Urs of Shah Jahan begins at Taj Mahal in Agra
141.article_body: The three-day Urs of Mughal emperor Shah Jahan started at the Taj Mahal in Agra on Sunday. Portals of the Taj Mahal basement housing the original graves of Shah Jahan and his consort Mumtaz Mahal were opened for visitors on the occasion. Entry to Taj Mahal was free from 2 pm on Sunday and will remain the same on Monday.

142.title: One of the most amazing experiences: Watson on playing in Pakistan
142.article_body: Terming playing in Pakistan as one of the most "amazing" experiences of his life, ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson said he was fortunate to play a few matches of Pakistan Premier League in the country. The 40-year-old represented Islamabad United and Quetta Gladiators in PSL. Meanwhile, Australia will be playing an all-format series in Pakistan after 24 years, beginning March 4.

143.title: TMC goons restricting my movement, can't perform duties: Cong MP
143.article_body: Congress' Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury wrote a letter to Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla over alleged incidents of violence in West Bengal municipal polls, alleging that he's unable to perform his duties as MP. Chowdhury, who is MP from Berhampore, alleged that he is often heckled and mobbed by Trinamool Congress' (TMC) "goons". "My movement is completely restricted [here]," he added.

144.title: US bans transactions with Russian central bank, National Wealth Fund
144.article_body: The United States on Monday banned its citizens and companies from carrying out transactions with the Russian central Bank, the National Wealth Fund and the Ministry of Finance. The move will immobilise any Russian central bank assets held in the US, the country's Treasury department said. The US also announced penalties on the Russian Direct Investment Fund (RDIF).

145.title: World poverty to rise as climate change hits food supplies: UN panel
145.article_body: Experts from UN's Intergovernmental Panel on Climate Change (IPCC) on Monday warned of a rise in global poverty as climate change and extreme weather will lead to reduced food production and increased food prices, if left unchecked. The report estimated up to 183 million additional people would become undernourished in low-income countries due to climate change by 2050.

146.title: Tanzanian plane with 14 people on board crashes off Comoros
146.article_body: A Tanzania-registered light aircraft with 14 passengers and crew on board crashed into the sea off Comoros on Saturday. Rescuers in the Indian Ocean archipelago have launched a search for the missing passengers and crew, local authorities said. "As long as we have not found any bodies, there is hope," a senior police official said.

147.title: UAE's flydubai suspends flights to Russia, Ukraine and Belarus
147.article_body: United Arab Emirates airline flydubai on Monday suspended some flights to Russia, Ukraine and Belarus up to March 8. As per a notice posted on its website, the carrier banned flights to Krasnodar, Rostov-on-Don, Kiev, Odessa and Minsk. This comes after Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24 killing at least 352 civilians including 14 children.

148.title: Ukrainian singer joins army, sings on deserted Kyiv street; video goes viral
148.article_body: Ukrainian singer Andriy Khlyvnyuk has volunteered to join the army to fight the Russian troops. In a video shared by the Armed Forces of Ukraine, Khlyvnyuk could be seen dressed in military attire, holding a gun and singing a folk song on an empty street in Kyiv. Khlyvnyuk is the lead singer of the BoomBox band.

149.title: China's Long March-8 rocket launches record 22 satellites in space
149.article_body: China's Long March-8 rocket on Sunday set a new domestic record by sending 22 satellites in space in a single flight. Made by seven institutes and private companies, the satellites were deployed for commercial remote sensing services, marine environment monitoring, forest fire prevention and disaster mitigation. The rocket was launched from Wenchang Spacecraft Launch Site in Hainan province.

150.title: Delhi govt discontinues discounts on MRP of liquor, cites crowding issue
150.article_body: The Delhi government’s excise department on Monday ordered discontinuation of discounts on MRP of liquor. In its order, the department said that while the discounts were intended to promote healthy competition and consumer choice, it also led to large crowds outside stores, which can aggravate COVID-19 cases. It added that the discounting also led to unhealthy market practices.

151.title: 224 new COVID cases, 11 deaths reported in B'luru in last 24 hours
151.article_body: Bengaluru Urban has reported 224 new COVID-19 cases in the state of Karnataka in the last 24 hours. The city also recorded 326 recoveries, or people being discharged on Sunday along with 11 virus-related deaths. Bengaluru Urban district now stands at a total of 17,78,361 coronavirus cases.

152.title: Cyberabad Police to auction over 600 abandoned vehicles, list shared
152.article_body: Cyberabad Police has announced that it'll be auctioning over 600 abandoned or unclaimed vehicles of various types and make. The vehicles are currently pooled at Pahadi Shareef PS Ground, Hyderabad. The force released list of total 621 vehicles and asked people, who might've objections or ownership interest in any of the vehicles to file an application and claim the vehicle.

153.title: Can't get over Alia's brilliant performance: Basu on 'Gangubai...'
153.article_body: Taking to Twitter, filmmaker Anurag Basu wrote, "It's been three days I have seen 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and I can't get over Alia's brilliant performance." He further added that the film's director, Sanjay Leela Bhansali, has reinstated his big screen magic again. In another tweet, Basu said that 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' is cinematographer Sudeep Chatterjee's best work to date.

154.title: G7 leaders to hold call with NATO and EU chiefs amid war in Ukraine
154.article_body: The leaders of G7 nations will hold a call with the Secretary General of NATO, EU chiefs and leaders of Romania and Poland on Monday, Italy said. Later, the European Commission President and leaders of Italy, France and Germany will hold a call, Itay added. Notably, Poland and Romania share a border with Ukraine, which has been invaded by Russia.

155.title: Dozens killed, hundreds hurt in Russian rocket strikes on Ukraine's Kharkiv
155.article_body: Dozens of people were killed in rocket strikes by Russia on the Ukrainian city of Kharkiv on Monday, Ukrainian Interior Ministry Adviser Anton Herashchenko said. Hundreds have been wounded in the strikes, Herashchenko said. This came even as peace talks between Ukraine and Russia started at the Belarusian border.

156.title: DGCA extends ban on regular commercial int'l passenger flights
156.article_body: The Directorate General of Civil Aviation (DGCA) on Monday extended the suspension of scheduled international commercial passenger flights to/from India till further orders. This restriction doesn't apply to international all-cargo operations, DGCA-approved flights and flights under air-bubble arrangement. The ban on scheduled international passenger flights has been in place since March 23, 2020.

157.title: My most memorable wicket was of Kohli, I knocked him over: O' Keefe
157.article_body: Australia spinner Steve O'Keefe has revealed dismissing Virat Kohli in first Test of 2017 Border-Gavaskar Trophy in Pune is his "most memorable" wicket. "I knocked him over, we were playing on this absolute dust bowl of a wicket, it was spinning...Ravi Shastri described the wicket of having dermatitis...it had holes in it," he added. O'Keefe took 12/70 in the Test.

158.title: 6th evacuation flight from Budapest with 240 Indians reaches Delhi
158.article_body: The sixth evacuation flight from Hungary's capital Budapest carrying 240 Indian nationals stranded in Ukraine landed at the Delhi airport on Monday. Union Minister Mukhtar Abbas Naqvi welcomed the Indian nationals at the airport. The Central Government has launched Operation Ganga to bring back Indians stranded in Ukraine.

159.title: Over 5 lakh have fled Ukraine since start of Russian invasion: UN
159.article_body: Over 5 lakh people have fled Ukraine since the start of Russia's invasion of the country last week, the UN refugee agency said on Monday. Of these, 2.81 lakh people have arrived in Poland, a UN spokeswoman said. Similarly, Hungary, Moldova, Romania and Slovakia have welcomed more than 84,500, about 36,400, over 32,500 and around 30,000 people from Ukraine, respectively.

160.title: Everyone wants Ranbir's response to 'Gangubai Kathiawadi': Alia
160.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, on being asked about her boyfriend actor Ranbir Kapoor's reaction to 'Gangubai Kathiawadi', said, "Sabko Ranbir ka response chahiye (Everyone wants Ranbir's response)." The actress further said that she will try to convince Ranbir to give a byte for the movie because he is not on social media. "How can I give his response?" Alia added.

161.title: Czech Republic supports Ukraine's bid to join EU: PM Fiala
161.article_body: Czech Republic supports Ukraine's efforts to join the European Union (EU), Czech PM Petr Fiala was quoted as saying by local media on Monday. It's necessary to give a clear signal that Ukraine is welcome in the European community of democratic countries, he added. This comes amid Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's request for a fast-track membership to the bloc.

162.title: Russia closes its airspace to 36 countries including UK and Germany
162.article_body: Russia on Monday barred airlines from 36 countries including Britain, Germany, Spain, Italy and Canada from using Russian airspace. Russia's state aviation agency said that planes from these countries could only enter Russia's airspace with special permission. The move follows a decision by the EU and Canada over the weekend to close their skies to the Russian planes.

163.title: India to send humanitarian aid including medicines to Ukraine
163.article_body: India will send humanitarian aid including medicines to Ukraine, the Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said on Monday. This came after India abstained from voting in the UNSC for a rare special emergency session of the UN General Assembly on the Russia-Ukraine conflict. India had earlier abstained from voting on a resolution condemning Russia.

164.title: Rahul Gandhi releases Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin's autobiography
164.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday released Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin's autobiography 'Ungalil Oruvan' (One Among You) in Chennai. Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan,  Leader of Opposition in Bihar Assembly Tejashwi Yadav and National Conference leader Omar Abdullah were also present. DMK leader Duraimurugan received the first copy of the book.

165.title: 86 kg marijuana seized from 10 peddlers in 3 cases in Bengaluru
165.article_body: Police have recovered 86 kg of ganja from ten peddlers in three different cases in Bengaluru. In one of the cases, the accused reportedly confessed to procuring around 80 kg marijuana at a lower price in Andhra Pradesh and allegedly selling it in Bengaluru at about ₹40,0000-50,000. About 3.5 and 2.5 kg of ganja was recovered in other two cases.

166.title: Hyderabad student arrested for buying 40 LSD blots from dark web
166.article_body: A Hyderabad Central University student was nabbed for allegedly buying 40 LSD blots from dark web on multiple occasions. The student is among several others, including IT professionals, a doctor and other students, arrested in a major drug bust involving three separate cases on Saturday. The Hyderabad Police ended up seizing drugs including MDMA, hash oil, ganja and LSD blots.

167.title: Supertech twin towers to be destroyed by May 22: Noida authority
167.article_body: Noida authority on Monday informed the Supreme Court that Supertech's twin 40-storey towers in its Emerald Court project will be demolished by May 22. The work on the demolition has already started, it said. The SC, on August 31, 2021, announced the demolition of the twin towers within three months for violation of building norms in "collusion with Noida officials."

168.title: Eaten only 3-4 spoons of rice in a day, we need help: Indian student in Ukraine
168.article_body: Speaking about her ordeal while being stuck in Ukraine, an Indian student said that she along with a few more students have eaten only three to four spoons of rice a day. She added, "We are roaming on the road and can meet with any fate. We need help." Another student has alleged harassment of female students by Ukrainian guards.

169.title: Hong Kong logs record over 34,000 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours
169.article_body: Hong Kong authorities on Monday reported 34,466 new COVID-19 cases in last 24 hours, increasing by four times from a week ago. "Once every three days the case number will double," said Albert Au, Principal Medical and Health Officer. On the other hand, Hong Kong Health Minister Sophia Chan said the government was "still discussing" the matter of lockdown.

170.title: Dera chief Ram Rahim brought back to jail after end of furlough
170.article_body: Dera Sacha Sauda chief Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh was brought back to Rohtak's Sunaria jail after the end of his 21-day furlough on Monday. He was granted the furlough to meet his family. Ram Rahim is serving a life term for the murder of his manager in 2002 and was also convicted for the rape of two women in 2017.

171.title: Qatar calls for diplomatic settlement between Ukraine and Russia
171.article_body: Qatar Foreign Minister Sheikh Mohammed bin Abdulrahman Al-Thani called for a diplomatic settlement between Ukraine, Russia. In a speech at Human Rights Council in Geneva, Al-Thani backed a settlement which will preserve Ukraine's sovereignty, territorial integrity within its recognised boundaries. This comes as Russia launched an invasion of Ukraine on February 24 killing at least 352 people.

172.title: Inappropriate to compare Ukraine’s situation with ours: Taiwan
172.article_body: Taiwanese government said on Monday that it’s inappropriate for people to compare Ukraine’s situation with theirs. Taiwan has a natural barrier (Taiwan Strait) that separates it from China, Cabinet spokesperson Lo Ping-cheng said. These remarks come after UK PM Boris Johnson said that Western indifference to Russian aggression in Ukraine could lead to threat to Taiwan.

173.title: Sushant's death a tough test for my relationship with Ankita: Vicky
173.article_body: Actress Ankita Lokhande's husband Vicky Jain has said that the death of actor Sushant Singh Rajput was a tough test for their relationship. Ankita and Sushant were in a relationship for six years before breaking up in 2016. Vicky further said that he was proud of how Ankita handled herself after Sushant's death, adding that she fulfilled her responsibility.

174.title: 71% jump in PSL 2022 profits, most in its history: Ramiz Raja
174.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board Chairman Ramiz Raja said Pakistan Super League 2022 has witnessed a jump of 71% in profits, which is the most in the tournament's history. He added every franchise earned PKR 900 million (over $5 million), all before the first ball was even bowled. Lahore Qalandars defeated Multan Sultans by 42 runs to win their maiden PSL trophy.
