175.title: Credit growth to industry rises to 6.4% in Jan 2022 from 0.7% in Jan 2021
175.article_body: Reserve Bank of India's data showed that India's credit growth to industry rose from 0.7% in January 2021 to 6.4% in January 2022. Credit growth to medium enterprises is pegged at 74.7% against 21.8% in January 2021. Credit growth to micro and small industries accelerated to 19.7% from 0.5% and credit to large industries rose to 0.5% against -0.2%.

176.title: Journey from Ukraine was hassle-free: B'luru students on return
176.article_body: Indians who returned to Bengaluru from Ukraine said they had a hassle-free journey due to efforts of Indian Embassy officials in Ukraine as well as in Hungary and Slovakia. A batch of 12 students from Karnataka has landed at the Bengaluru airport on Sunday. MEA Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said as of now, six flights have arrived carrying around 1,400 Indians.

177.title: Even if you win Ballon d'Or 7 times, you've to adapt: Mbappe on Messi
177.article_body: Talking about Lionel Messi, Paris Saint-Germain forward Kylian Mbappe said, "I'm happy for him because we know he's adjusting to a new life, a new city and a new club." He added, "Even when you win Ballon d'Or seven times, you have to adapt too." Kylian opined that Messi is "getting better and better" at the club.

178.title: Adapting to Pak conditions will be challenge for Australia: Watson
178.article_body: Former Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has said that he is "super excited" for the Australia tour of Pakistan. This is Australia's first tour of Pakistan since 1998. "I think it is going to be an exceptional challenge for the Australian team to try and adapt to the Pakistan conditions when they haven't been there for so long," Watson stated.

179.title: Go to West Ukraine but don't go directly to border: India to Indians in Ukraine
179.article_body: Ministry of External Affairs has advised Indians stuck in Ukraine to go to West Ukraine but not go directly to the borders. "There's rush there (at the borders), it'll take time. Go to nearby cities, seek shelter there," said MEA spokesperson Arindam Bagchi. "We're making arrangements there, our teams will help you. Don't panic, we have enough flights," he added.

180.title: Ukrainian man moves landmine with bare hands while smoking a cigarette
180.article_body: A video of a Ukrainian man moving a landmine with his bare hands while smoking a cigarette has gone viral on social media. Media outlet The New Voice of Ukraine tweeted, "A Ukrainian spotted a mine on the road...and didn't wait around for a bomb disposal unit." It added, "At great risk to life and limb, he removed the mine."

181.title: US closes embassy in Belarus, allows non-essential staff to leave Russia
181.article_body: The United States on Monday suspended operations at its Belarus embassy and allowed the non-essential staff and their families at the US Embassy in Russia to leave the country amid the situation in Ukraine. "We took these steps due to security and safety issues stemming from the unprovoked...attack by Russian military forces in Ukraine," said Secretary of State Antony Blinken.

182.title: Govt's fiscal deficit rises to 59% of FY22 target in Apr 2021-Jan 2022
182.article_body: The Centre's fiscal deficit rose to 58.9% of its FY22 target between April 2021 and January 2022, data by the Controller General of Accounts showed. In Budget 2021, the government had aimed for a fiscal deficit of 6.8% of the GDP in FY22. Centre's capital expenditure in April 2021-January 2022 recorded a 22% YoY rise to ₹4.42 lakh crore.

183.title: Woman loses ₹3.25 lakh in cyber fraud in Noida
183.article_body: A woman from Noida lost ₹3.25 lakh after a cyber fraudster stole her bank account details on the pretext of updating the know your customer (KYC) details of her phone number. The fraudster had asked the victim to pay ₹10 online to reactivate her phone services. Subsequently, the money was withdrawn from the victim's bank account.

184.title: Biocon Biologics acquires Viatris' biosimilars assets in ₹25,169 cr deal
184.article_body: India's largest biopharmaceutical firm Biocon Biologics Ltd (BBL) signed a pact with Viatris to acquire the latter's biosimilars business for up to $3.34 billion (₹25,169 crore) in cash and stock. Viatris will receive $2 billion (₹15,071 crore) in cash on closing of the transaction and up to $335 million (₹2,524 crore) as additional payments expected to be paid in 2024.

185.title: Too early to do that: Rajkumar on India looking beyond Kohli, Rohit in T20Is
185.article_body: Disagreeing with a suggestion of replacing Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma in T20Is, Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma said, "It's too early to do that." He added, "Rohit is a master player in T20s. On his day, he can single-handedly win games for the team...don't think wholesale changes are needed." Notably, India is on a 12-match winning streak in T20Is.

186.title: MLA Raja Bhaiya booked for thrashing SP worker amid UP elections
186.article_body: Kunda MLA Raghuraj Pratap Singh, also known as Raja Bhaiya, has been booked for thrashing a polling agent of the SP ahead of the sixth phase of the Uttar Pradesh elections. An FIR has been filed against Raja Bhaiya and 17 others at the Kunda police station. Provisions of the SC/ST Act and IPC sections have been invoked.

187.title: 5 khadi shops gutted as fire breaks out in Dalhousie market
187.article_body: Five khadi shops were burnt to ashes after a fire broke out at the Gandhi Chowk Market in Himachal Pradesh's Dalhousie on Monday. SDM Jagan Thakur said the cause of fire is being ascertained. Fire tenders were rushed to the spot and the blaze was brought under control in two hours. No loss of life was reported in the mishap.

188.title: Noida Police arrest 26-yr-old man for killing friend
188.article_body: Noida Police on Sunday arrested 26-year-old Chandra Bhan for killing his friend Sanjeev Kumar, who shared a rented accommodation with him in Noida's Phase 2. The police said that Kumar was in an illicit relationship with Bhan's wife. When Bhan came to know about the affair, he strangled Kumar and fled with his wife, the police added.

189.title: Former acting DGP Sanjay Pandey appointed new Mumbai Police chief
189.article_body: The Maharashtra government has appointed former Maharashtra acting Director General of Police Sanjay Pandey as the new Mumbai Police Commissioner. He has replaced Hemant Nagrale, who was given the post after Param Bir Singh was shunted as the Mumbai Police chief. Nagrale will now be the Managing Director of the Maharashtra State Security Corporation.

190.title: Ukraine shares video of drone strikes on Russian convoy, says 'Fear, enemies!'
190.article_body: The Ukrainian air force carried out two drone strikes on a Russian convoy of more than a dozen vehicles using Turkish-made Bayraktar TB2 drones. Footage of the strike was also released on social media. Sharing the video on Twitter, the Armed Forces of Ukraine wrote, "Fear, enemies! There will be no peace for you on our earth!"

191.title: India's GDP growth slows to 5.4% in Q3 of FY22 compared to 8.4% in Q2
191.article_body: India's GDP growth slowed down to 5.4% during the third quarter of 2021-2022 compared to 8.4% in the previous quarter, the Ministry of Statistics and Programme Implementation said on Monday. It also estimated that India's GDP will likely grow by 8.9% in 2021-22. In its first advanced estimate, the government had estimated the GDP in 2021-22 to grow by 9.2%.

192.title: Former Rajya Sabha MP Yadlapati Venkata Rao passes away at 102
192.article_body: Former Rajya Sabha MP and veteran Telugu Desam Party (TDP) leader Yadlapati Venkata Rao passed away at the age of 102 in Hyderabad on Monday. Rao, who was nominated to the Rajya Sabha in 1998, had previously served as Agriculture Minister in undivided Andhra Pradesh in the late 1970s. Rao was affiliated with Congress before he joined TDP in 1983.

193.title: Delhi man harasses colleague by making fake accounts, arrested
193.article_body: The Delhi Police's cyber cell on Sunday arrested a man for harassing and stalking his colleague by creating fake social media accounts in her name to send defamatory messages to her family and friends. The accused disclosed that he was in a relationship with the woman for the last 10 years, but later the woman started ignoring him, police said.

194.title: Around 1,400 Indians brought back to India from Ukraine on 6 flights: Govt
194.article_body: As many as 1,396 Indians have been brought back to India from Ukraine in six flights, the government said on Monday. Four flights have arrived from Bucharest (Romania) and two flights from Budapest (Hungary), Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. Around 8,000 Indians have left Ukraine since the current conflict with Russia began, he said.

195.title: Development of UP is my responsibility & priority: PM Modi in Ballia
195.article_body: Addressing a rally in poll-bound UP's Ballia on Monday, PM Modi said that development of the state is his "responsibility and priority". "I have an emotional connect with Ballia as...scheme to provide free gas cylinders Ujjwala was launched from here," PM added. Ballia will vote in the sixth phase of UP Assembly elections, which will be held on March 3.

196.title: Airbnb to house up to 1 lakh Ukrainian refugees for free, says CEO
196.article_body: Airbnb will provide free short-term housing for up to 1 lakh refugees fleeing Ukraine amid Russian invasion, the startup's CEO Brian Chesky announced on Twitter. Airbnb's senior executives have written to the governments of Poland, Romania, Germany and Hungary offering their support for housing refugees. The housing will be funded by Airbnb, donors and hosts on the platform, Chesky said.

197.title: Kazakh firm blocks Russian TV stations over Russia-Ukraine war
197.article_body: Kazakhstan's Remstroyservice company on Monday blocked Russian TV stations over their coverage of Russian invasion of Ukraine. "We are against war and against war propaganda," said Shakhtinsk-based company. Remstroyservice added they are running Kazakh state TV instead of all major Russian stations. This comes after at least 352 people were killed after Russia invaded Ukraine on February 24.

198.title: Satellite pic shows 5-km long convoy of Russian troops deployed near Kyiv
198.article_body: A satellite picture released by Maxar Technologies showed an over 5-km long convoy of Russian troops comprising hundreds of military vehicles deployed near the Ukrainian capital Kyiv. The convoy contained fuel, logistics and armoured vehicles including tanks, infantry fighting vehicles and self-propelled artillery, Maxar Technologies said. Russia-Ukraine war entered its fifth day today.

199.title: Google Maps stops showing Ukraine's live traffic worldwide temporarily
199.article_body: Google has globally disabled the Google Maps traffic layer and live information on how busy places like stores and restaurants are in Ukraine. Google said the decision was taken for the safety of local communities in the country, after consulting with sources including regional authorities. Live traffic information remains available to drivers using its turn-by-turn navigation features in Ukraine.

200.title: Carry enough cash, ready to eat meals: Indian embassy to students in Ukraine
200.article_body: The Indian embassy in Ukraine has released a second advisory for its nationals stranded in the country amid the Russian invasion. Referring to the students, it asked them to carry their passports, enough cash, ready to eat meals and winter clothing. The embassy also appreciated the Ukrainian authorities for supporting the evacuation of Indian citizens during these "dangerous times".

201.title: Headmistress of DPS Faridabad arrested in student's suicide case
201.article_body: Faridabad Police on Sunday arrested the headmistress of Delhi Public School, Faridabad on the charge of abetment of suicide, days after a class 10 student died by suicide after allegedly being harassed over his sexuality. Police said that a note was recovered on Friday, in which the 16-year-old allegedly blamed the school and "higher authorities."

202.title: Amul increases price for milk across India by ₹2 per litre
202.article_body: Amul is increasing the price for its milk across India by ₹2 per litre. The increased price of Amul milk will be applicable from tomorrow, March 1. Amul said that it is increasing the price of milk due to an increase in the prices of energy, packaging, transportation cost and animal feed.

203.title: Probe war crimes in Ukraine: Lithuania to International Criminal Court
203.article_body: Lithuanian government announced on Monday that it will ask prosecutors in International Criminal Court to investigate war crimes in Ukraine due to Russian military offensive. "There's new material coming in every day, but we have enough of it by now to file...request," Lithuanian PM Ingrida Šimonytė said. At least 102 Ukrainian civilians have been killed since Russian invasion, UN said.

204.title: Mumbai man beats wife to death, tries to stage it as accident
204.article_body: A 27-year-old man in Mumbai's Dharavi, who beat his 22-year-old wife to death last week before trying to stage the crime as an accident, has been charged with her murder. The accused, Rahul Jaiswal, told doctors that she had fallen from the mezzanine floor and fell unconscious. However, a post-mortem reportedly led to the revelation that she had been killed.

205.title: Harshal is getting better and better since the IPL 2021: Zaheer
205.article_body: Ex-India fast bowler Zaheer Khan said Harshal Patel is "getting better and better" since the IPL 2021. "Harshal has played all the games...with consistency as well," he added. Harshal had won the Purple Cap in IPL 2021 after taking 32 wickets. In the recently concluded T20I series against West Indies and Sri Lanka, Harshal scalped five and two wickets, respectively.

206.title: I move on quick: Shreyas after his 3 half-centuries in SL T20I series
206.article_body: Talking about his current form, India batter Shreyas Iyer, who was adjudged 'Player of the Series' in T20I series against Sri Lanka, said he tries to move on quickly as people tend to forget the past performances. Shreyas scored three half-centuries (57*, 74*, 73*) in the series. Shreyas had scored 105 on his Test debut in Kanpur in November 2021.

207.title: BMC to install new bus shelters at 105 places in Mumbai suburbs
207.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) will be replacing existing bus shelters with new ones at 105 locations in Mumbai's eastern and western suburbs as part of its Tactical Urbanism plan. The project aims to maximise use of public spaces to make them available for citizens. The new shelters will have transparent enclosures and movable metal benches clamped on the footpath.

208.title: Lufthansa cancels 30 flights to Russia amid Russia-Ukraine war
208.article_body: German flag airline, Lufthansa on Monday said they cancelled 30 flights of Lufthansa, Eurowings and Austrian Airlines carriers to Russia this week. This comes after the country on Saturday said it was preparing to shut its airspace to Russian planes. At least 352 people including 14 children were killed after Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

209.title: 800 protesters arrested in Belarus amid vote on non-nuclear status
209.article_body: Around 800 people have been arrested in Belarus as the country voted to revoke its non-nuclear status through a constitutional referendum vote, the Belarusian government said on Monday. Protesters had taken to the streets across Belarus and chanted anti-war slogans amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine. Belarus' vote came after Russia put its nuclear deterrent forces on high alert.

210.title: Mumbai-Navi Mumbai water taxi runs only 3 trips in 10 days
210.article_body: The first-ever water taxi service between Mumbai and Navi Mumbai has run only three trips in 10 days after inauguration on February 17. The CEO of Maharashtra Maritime Board, the nodal agency for the project, said a meeting will be held with all stakeholders to find a solution on March 2. A one-way ticket is priced between ₹800 to ₹1,200.

211.title: India's fourth COVID-19 wave may begin around June 22: IIT Kanpur study
211.article_body: The fourth wave of COVID-19 in India may start around June 22 and may peak from mid to late August, a modelling study by researchers at the IIT-Kanpur has indicated. The researchers, however, noted that a possible new variant of coronavirus may impact the whole analysis. The impact will depend on the possible variant's infectibility, fatality, etc, they said.

212.title: EU acting hostile, weapon supplies to Ukraine dangerous: Russia
212.article_body: Russia on Monday accused the European Union of acting hostile towards it and warned against the supply of weapons to Ukraine. "EU is acting in a hostile fashion towards us. Weapons' supplies to Ukraine are dangerous and destabilising," said Russia. This comes after the EU promised to finance the purchase and delivery of weapons and equipment to Ukraine.

213.title: Roman-era tombs from 1st century AD found at Gaza construction site
213.article_body: Construction workers unearthed Roman-era tombs from 2,000 years ago at a construction site in Beit Lahia, Gaza. Confirming the discovery, Naji Sarhan, spokesperson of Gaza's Ministry of Public Works said there are other graves at site. While construction has been halted at the site, experts from Gaza's Ministry of Antiquities and Tourism have been sent to inspect gravestones and artefacts.

214.title: Hong Kong mortuaries run out of space as COVID-19 deaths mount
214.article_body: The mortuaries in Hong Kong ran out of space to store bodies amid a surge in COVID-19 fatalities. According to Tony Ling, head of the city's Public Doctors Association, dozens of bodies are lying at hospitals waiting to be transported to mortuaries. "These bodies now need extra time to wait for collection because resources are just so tight," said Ling.

215.title: It'll be made, it's a dream: Bhushan on Gulshan Kumar biopic with Aamir
215.article_body: T-Series MD Bhushan Kumar said that 'Mogul', a film based on the life of his father and the company's founder Gulshan Kumar, will happen for sure. The biopic will feature Aamir Khan as Gulshan. "It'll be...little later...because Aamir sir's film (Laal Singh Chaddha) has been delayed...I'm in no hurry to make [it]...It's not...project for me, it's a dream," Bhushan said.

216.title: What a blast we had shooting: Shilpa Shetty on 25 yrs of 'Auzaar'
216.article_body: As film 'Auzaar' completed 25 years, actress Shilpa Shetty Kundra recalled working on the project. Taking to Instagram, Shilpa posted a video, which features a few scenes from the movie. She captioned it, "Working with friends never quite felt like work even back then. What a blast we had shooting #Auzaar...with such fabulous co-stars like @beingsalmankhan @sanjaykapoor2500."

217.title: Ukraine demands immediate ceasefire, withdrawal of Russian troops
217.article_body: Ukraine on Monday demanded an immediate ceasefire and withdrawal of the Russian troops from its territories. This comes as a Ukrainian delegation reached Belarusian town of Gomel to hold talks with the Russian counterpart. "The Ukrainian delegation arrived at the Ukrainian-Belarusian border to take part in talks with representatives of the Russian Federation," the Ukrainian presidency said.

218.title: Scientists reveal 4.4 million galaxies via radio telescope
218.article_body: A team of international scientists revealed an "astonishingly detailed" radio image of 4.4 million galaxies through Low Frequency Array (LOFAR), a pan-European radio telescope. The team used algorithms on high-performance computers across Europe to process observations lasting 3,500 hours. This release is only 27 per cent of the entire survey, said Timothy Shimwell of Leiden University.

219.title: Govt revises travel guidelines for Indians being evacuated from Ukraine
219.article_body: The Ministry of Health and Family Welfare (MoHFW) on Monday revised its international travel advisory, providing certain exemptions to Indians being evacuated from war-hit Ukraine. Mandatory pre-boarding negative RT-PCR test report or full vaccination certificate have been exempted for Indians. Indians have also been exempted from uploading these documents on Air Suvidha portal before departure.

220.title: Salman threw his diary at me when I asked for 'Har Dil Jo...' dates: Sajid
220.article_body: Film producer Sajid Nadiadwala said he and actor Salman Khan got into an argument over dates for the film 'Har Dil Jo Pyar Karega'. Sajid said he told Salman the shooting was to begin in 20 days. "He threw his diary at me...I took diary and adjusted his dates. I cancelled few of his scheduled dates, added mine," he added.

221.title: A movie that slapped patriarchy: Taapsee on two years of 'Thappad'
221.article_body: As film 'Thappad' completed two years, actress Taapsee Pannu shared a post for the film. Sharing a video compilation of several glimpses from the film, Taapsee captioned it, "Celebrating two years of @anubhavsinhaa's Thappad, the movie that confidently called out the flawed societal norms and slapped patriarchy!" Actress Dia Mirza also shared the same video on her Instagram handle.

222.title: Shibani gets wedding date with Farhan tattooed, shares pics
222.article_body: Actress Shibani Dandekar has gotten her wedding date with actor-filmmaker Farhan Akhtar tattooed on the back of her left forearm in Roman numerals which reads XXI.II.XXII. The couple got married on February 19 at a private ceremony in Khandala. Shibani had gotten Farhan's name tattooed on her neck as a birthday gift to him last year.

223.title: Diljit, Arjun Rampal to star in Honey's film based on true events: Reports
223.article_body: Diljit Dosanjh and Arjun Rampal will reportedly share screen space in an upcoming film, which will be helmed by 'Raat Akeli Hai' director Honey Trehan. According to reports, Diljit will play an activist who'll fight for the victims of the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. It's being jointly produced by Ronnie Screwvala, Honey and Abhishek Chaubey, as per reports.

224.title: Major fire breaks out in Mumbai's Kanjurmarg area, no casualty reported
224.article_body: A "level-2 (major) fire" broke out on Monday afternoon in the NG Royal Park residential building located in Mumbai's Kanjurmarg (East), a fire official said. The fire was confined to the ninth and tenth floors of the building and there was no report of any casualty, the official added. Six fire engines, four jumbo tankers were rushed to the spot.

225.title: India's priority is to evacuate students, our priority is to stop war: Ukraine envoy
225.article_body: India's priority is to evacuate students, our priority is to stop the war and exert pressure on Russia, said Ukraine's Ambassador to India Igor Polikha. He added, "We are requesting all our foreign partners to exert pressure on Russian President Vladimir Putin to stop the war." The government is sending four Union Ministers to Ukraine's neighbouring countries to coordinate evacuation.

226.title: Mamata offers unconditional support to PM on Ukraine crisis, seeks all-party meet
226.article_body: West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee has written to PM Narendra Modi, offering her "unconditional support" amid the Russia-Ukraine crisis. Mamata also requested him to consider convening an all-party meeting. "In times of grave international crisis we keep aside our domestic disagreements to stand united as a nation...India must take lead to offer a peaceful solution to the world," she wrote.

227.title: Thought we'd be saved just like in movies, doesn't seem so now: Indian in Ukraine
227.article_body: Indian student Garima Mishra from UP appealed for help from the Indian government while being stranded amidst war in Ukraine, saying, "We used to see this in movies. We thought we would be saved." She added, "But now it doesn't seem like we will be saved...Please send someone by air to help us. Send the Indian Army."

228.title: Business with Russia means financing Hitler of 21st century: Ukraine Foreign Minister
228.article_body: Ukraine Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba took to Twitter to urge countries to cut all business ties with Russia. He wrote, "Making business with Russia today means financing aggression, war crimes, disinformation, cyberattacks and personally the Hitler of the 21st century named Vladimir Putin." The Ukraine-Russia war entered its fifth day today.

229.title: Dynasts can never make India capable: PM Narendra Modi
229.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said dynasts can never make India capable. "Dynasts can never make India capable, they can never make UP capable. Can these dynasts do anything?" PM Modi added. "During the COVID-19 period, they left no stone unturned to hurt the confidence of India. They tried to instigate the poor of the country against the indigenous vaccines," he stated.

230.title: Harshal bowling too many slower balls, Unadkat did the same: Rajkumar Sharma
230.article_body: Virat Kohli's childhood coach Rajkumar Sharma has said India pacer Harshal Patel is bowling too many slower balls and needs to vary his deliveries. "Jaydev Unadkat was also doing the same, which made him predictable...Harshal needs to mix it up. He bowls the slower one really well," Rajkumar added. Harshal conceded 52 runs in the second Sri Lanka T20I.

231.title: Wrestler Ravi Dahiya wins gold at Yasar Dogu Ranking Series
231.article_body: Tokyo Olympics silver medallist wrestler Ravi Dahiya defeated Uzbekistan's Gulomjon Abdullaev 11-10 in the 61kg final to win gold in Yasar Dogu Ranking Series in Istanbul. Dahiya was trailing 8-10, but stood better in his last move in the final. Dahiya, who won the Olympics silver in men's freestyle 57kg, had lost to Abdullaev in Poland last year.

232.title: Ukrainian children appeal for help in video, say 'We are afraid, we want to live'
232.article_body: Ukraine's Centre for Strategic Communications and Information Security took to Twitter to share a video of children appealing to foreigners to save their lives in a video amid war with Russia. In the video, the children say that they are afraid and want to live. Russia's attack on Ukraine reached its fifth day today.

233.title: Ukraine man partially sinks Russian boss' ₹59-cr yacht, says 'No regrets' after arrest
233.article_body: A Ukrainian sailor in Spain was arrested after he partially sank his Russian boss' luxury yacht worth €7 million (around ₹59 crore). While he was later released, he said he didn’t regret his actions as his boss was a "criminal who sells weapons that kill the Ukrainian people". His boss had taken over a Russian state-owned weapons supplier in 2016.

234.title: Who is Madhabi Puri Buch, the first-ever woman to head SEBI?
234.article_body: Madhabi Puri Buch has been appointed as the first-ever woman Chairperson of SEBI. She was not only SEBI's first woman whole-time member but also the first person working at SEBI from the private sector. An IIM Ahmedabad alumna, Buch started her career with ICICI Bank, joined Greater Pacific Capital in Singapore and also served at New Development Bank in Shanghai.

235.title: Yami shares pics with kids from 'A Thursday', calls them 'cutest co-actors'
235.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam took to Instagram to share pictures with her children co-actors from the film 'A Thursday'. "Cutest co-actors I ever got to work with...Stepping in Naina's shoes was way more challenging than I had imagined while preparing for the part...But somewhere these little kids came in as a breather," she wrote.

236.title: Rohit is in the XI because of his batting, shouldn't lose focus: Saba
236.article_body: Former India wicketkeeper Saba Karim has said that Rohit Sharma shouldn't lose focus with the bat after being named Team India captain in all formats. "Rohit is in the XI because of his batting. Captaincy is an additional responsibility," he stated. "Lot of times we've seen...captains are not able to perform as well in their primary skill," he added.

237.title: Samantha shares article praising Ukraine President's courage amid invasion
237.article_body: Actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu on Monday took to Instagram to share an article praising Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's courage amid the Russian invasion. The article is titled 'A Prayer for Volodymyr Zelensky' and the excerpt read, "History has found the Ukrainian President and his courage is remarkable to witness." Several pictures of the Russian invasion have surfaced on social media.

238.title: Vidyut to host a show on martial arts, titled 'India's Ultimate Warrior'
238.article_body: Actor Vidyut Jammwal is set to host a reality show exploring martial arts and combat skills, titled 'India's Ultimate Warrior'. The actor, who is trained in Kalaripayattu, an ancient martial art form that originated in Kerala, will find the "ultimate warrior, who has the right blend of physical and mental attributes like focus, control, determination, balance and discipline".

239.title: Virat Kohli should be opening the innings with Rohit Sharma: Hogg
239.article_body: Former Australia spinner Brad Hogg said Virat Kohli should open the innings along with skipper Rohit Sharma for India in the T20Is. "For me, if you're going to have Kohli in the team, he should be opening the batting with Rohit," Hogg stated. As an opener, Kohli has played eight T20I matches for India and has scored 278 runs.

240.title: 64-year-old Delhi man arrested for cheating 60 people of over ₹14 crore
240.article_body: A 64-year-old man has been arrested in Delhi for allegedly cheating over 60 people, including government and public sector employees, of over ₹14 crore by assuring them possession of a flat in a housing project in Greater Noida, police said. The accused, one of the directors of Shubhkamna Buildtech Pvt Ltd, had promised to deliver the project by 2013.

241.title: If Salman hates someone, the person will get to know: Pooja Hegde
241.article_body: Speaking about working with Salman Khan in 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', actress Pooja Hegde said he's a "real person". "He's very sweet...So it's...easy to communicate with someone like that," she added. "What I love about him is that if he loves you...he really does, you can tell that. And if he hates you, you can tell that too," Pooja said.

242.title: Opp'n tried to promote vaccine hesitancy by creating doubts: PM Modi
242.article_body: Opposition tried to promote vaccine hesitancy by creating doubts in the poor people's minds, said Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Monday. "Those Indians who felt proud by knowing that vaccines were Made in India were incited by the Opposition not to take the doses," PM Modi added. "Even the big countries...are far behind India in vaccination coverage today," he added.

243.title: Marathi actress reveals ATM details to cyber fraudsters, loses ₹1.48 lakh
243.article_body: A 64-year-old Marathi actress was cheated of ₹1.48 lakh after a text message from her telecom operator allegedly asked her to update her know your customer (KYC) details and added that her number will be blocked if she failed to do so. It asked her to reveal her ATM card details after which money from her bank account was withdrawn.

244.title: If they think I'll let down audience, I won't take money: Ronit on TV return
244.article_body: While talking about how one can convince him for a show, Actor Ronit Roy, who will be seen in show 'Swaran Ghar' said he looks for the story, if he finds it interesting and what is his part in the story. "But if they think I'm going to let down my audience, then I won't take the money," he added.

245.title: Bulgarian Defence Minister to be sacked for not calling Russian invasion a war
245.article_body: Bulgaria's Prime Minister Kiril Petkov has said he would sack Defence Minister Stefan Yanev for terming the Russian invasion of Ukraine as an operation and not war. "My Defence Minister cannot use the word 'operation' instead of 'war'. You cannot call it an operation when thousands of soldiers from the one and the other side are already killed," Petkov said.

246.title: Cong's Mekedatu padayatra is for political gains: K'taka CM
246.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Monday said Congress' Mekedatu padayatra (foot march) demanding the implementation of the Mekedatu project across the Cauvery River is for political gains. Congress failed to even make Mekedatu's Detailed Project Report when they were in power, Bommai said. Congress resumed the padayatra on Sunday after temporarily stopping it in January amid rising COVID-19 cases.

247.title: BJP only party to confidently say we did what we promised: Nadda
247.article_body: BJP is the only party that can confidently say we did what we promised, JP Nadda, BJP chief said on Monday. "Earlier, children of poor (people) used to study under a lantern but now they are studying under full bright light as we have given 24 hours electricity," Nadda added while addressing a rally in Machhali Shahar, Jaunpur.

248.title: When I saw Bumrah, I wondered how he could bowl fast with his action: Shami
248.article_body: Talking about his relationship with pacer Jasprit Bumrah, Mohammad Shami recalled when he first saw the 28-year-old in the IPL. "It felt a bit strange seeing him because of his bowling action. I wondered how someone could bowl so fast with that action and where he got the power from," stated Shami, adding that Bumrah has "everything" in his bowling.

249.title: Man arrested for selling fake branded clothes in Hyderabad
249.article_body: A man accused of selling counterfeit versions of branded clothes in Hyderabad was arrested by Rachakonda Police on Saturday. The accused, identified as Sandi Satyapal Reddy, was nabbed by Special Operations Team (SOT) in LB Nagar zone. Fake garments worth over ₹2 lakh of brands including Louis Philippe and Allen Solly were also recovered from the accused's possession, police added.

250.title: War doesn't take sides, it causes loss of lives: Iulia on Russia-Ukraine crisis
250.article_body: Actor-model Iulia Vantur took to Instagram Stories to react to the Russia-Ukraine crisis. She wrote, "War does not take sides. It only causes loss of life and suffering." "My heart goes out to innocent lives lost in this war. The only side I am on is that may humanity choose peace against every option possible," she further wrote.

251.title: 'Shri Akhand Path Sahib' recited at Delhi gurdwara for well being of Indians in Ukraine
251.article_body: The Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee (DSGMC) organised a 'Shri Akhand Path Sahib' (recital) of Guru Granth Sahib at Gurdwara Bangla Sahib for the well being of Indians stranded in Ukraine. "Government should ensure that our citizens don't face any problem there and they should be brought to India soon," Atma Singh Lubana, Vice President, DSGMC said.

252.title: Pune woman going to office killed after being hit by speeding vehicle
252.article_body: A 24-year-old woman riding a motorcycle was killed after being hit by a speeding vehicle in Pune's Bavdhan, police said. The woman, a resident of Sinhagad Road, was going to her office in Baner on February 25 when the incident took place. She had received major injuries, leading to her death, police added.

253.title: Man out on interim bail in murder case killed in South Delhi
253.article_body: A 28-year-old man, who was out of jail on an interim bail after being involved in a murder case, was shot dead by unidentified assailants in South Delhi on Monday. The deceased, Shivam Pandey, was lodged in the Tihar jail from 2016 to 2020. Police said they got call at 3 am about firing and that several bullets were fired.

254.title: Hrithik & Tiger don't stop practising until they've perfected a step: Dharmesh
254.article_body: Choreographer Dharmesh Yelande has said he really likes Hrithik Roshan and Tiger Shroff in terms of acting and dancing. "I've worked with them, and I've witnessed how particular they're about everything they do. They don't stop practising a particular step until it's perfect," he added. "Be it a hard step or an easy one, they perform everything with...perfection," said Dharmesh.

255.title: Don't want to give details on my wedding, it's nobody's business: Alia
255.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt, who's reportedly in a relationship with actor Ranbir Kapoor, said that she likes to keep her private life guarded. "I don't want to give out details of when I'm getting married because it's nobody's business," she added. "But people are speculating and talking about it, now that there is something I can't do much about," Alia said.

256.title: No plans to play Spider-Man again, but no one believes me: Andrew
256.article_body: Actor Andrew Garfield, on being asked if he will portray Spider-Man again, said that there are no plans and "that's the truth". The actor further said, "Everyone's going to call me a liar for the rest of my life. I am the boy who cried wolf now." Andrew had earlier denied his appearance in Tom Holland-starrer 'Spider-Man: No Way Home'.

257.title: I just want to see one left-arm bowler in Indian squad for T20 WC: Irfan
257.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Irfan Pathan has said that he wants to see one left-arm fast bowler in the Indian squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "A left-arm bowler and that can be whoever performs in the IPL, Khaleel Ahmed, T Natarajan or Chetan Sakariya...Left is always right," he stated. ICC men's 2022 T20 World Cup will take place in October-November.

258.title: Ukrainians block movement of Russian tanks that stopped to seek directions
258.article_body: Hundreds of unarmed Ukrainian locals surrounded Russian tanks on the outskirts of Koryukivka in Ukraine after the Russian soldiers stopped to ask for directions on Monday. Videos of the incident showed Ukrainian men and women standing in front of the tanks and blocking their movement. A Ukrainian man was earlier filmed trying to block a Russian tank convoy.

259.title: What are the features of 'Mriya', world's largest plane destroyed by Russia in Ukraine?
259.article_body: Ukraine has said that the world's largest plane, Antonov An-225 'Mriya', was destroyed by Russian occupants on an airfield near Kyiv on Sunday. 'Mriya', which means "dream" in Ukrainian, is powered by six turbofan engines, has a wingspan of 290 feet, and a maximum payload weight of 2,50,000 kg. Only one An-225 was ever built by the Kiev-based Antonov company.

260.title: Those who troll on religion are not real Indians: Mohammad Shami
260.article_body: Talking about getting trolled after Pakistan's victory against India in T20 World Cup 2021, pacer Mohammad Shami said, "Those who troll on religion aren't real fans...nor are they real Indians." He added, "If you consider a player as hero and then behave this way...you aren't being an Indian supporter....I feel one shouldn't get hurt by comments made by such people."

261.title: I was advised to get breast implants at 18: Deepika Padukone
261.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone has revealed that the worst advice she ever received was to get breast implants. "I was all of 18 and I often wonder how I had the wisdom to not take it seriously," the actress said. Deepika had recounted this in an earlier interview as well, saying she was told it was the way to get recognised.

262.title: Ukrainian public figures targeted by 'Ghostwriter' hacking group: Meta
262.article_body: The social media accounts of a handful of Ukrainian public figures, including military officials and politicians, were compromised by a hacking group known as 'Ghostwriter', Meta said. The hackers attempted to post videos portraying Ukrainian troops as weakened. It added that it had separately disabled a network of fake accounts, groups and pages across Facebook and Instagram targeting Ukraine.

263.title: Mayank will lead Punjab Kings to successful IPL campaign: Kumble
263.article_body: After Mayank Agarwal was appointed as Punjab Kings captain, head coach Anil Kumble said he believes the opener will lead the franchise to a successful IPL campaign. "He is hardworking, enthusiastic, a team player with all the attributes required of a leader," Kumble added. With 441 runs from 12 matches, Mayank was the second-highest run-scorer for PBKS in IPL 2021.

264.title: Ukrainian woman soldier says 'I'm still alive, everything will be fine'; video viral
264.article_body: A video of a Ukrainian woman soldier has gone viral on social media, where she's saying, "I'm still alive, the sun is shining, the birds are singing...everything will be fine." The woman's identity and the original source of the video are unknown. Several people praised her courage while a tweet also read, "This is simultaneously so beautiful, and just heart-wrenching."

265.title: 42-yr-old tribal man flogged by police in J'khand; CM Soren orders inquiry
265.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren has ordered an inquiry after pictures of a 42-year-old tribal man, who was allegedly flogged by the police in Latehar district for "dropping off Maoists" in the forest area, surfaced on social media. The victim alleged he was beaten till he fell unconscious. "Jharkhand Police, take immediate cognisance of the matter," the CM tweeted.

266.title: How many nuclear weapons does Russia have in comparison to other countries?
266.article_body: As per the data released by the Arms Control Association, a US-based nonpartisan organisation, Russia has the highest number of nuclear weapons at 6,257, followed by the US which has 5,550 of them. They are followed by China (350), France (290), the UK (225), Pakistan (165), India (156), Israel (90) and North Korea (40-50). Notably, Ukraine has no nuclear weapons.

267.title: 10 students from Maharashtra return to Pune from Ukraine
267.article_body: A batch of 10 students stuck in Ukraine returned to Pune by a special Air India flight on Sunday. The students are from different parts of Maharashtra. On reaching Pune, a 20-year-old student said, "We are fortunate enough to come back safely to our country as the third batch of students there are now facing a lot of problems."

268.title: Delhi Police sets up e-kiosk for contactless complaint registration
268.article_body: A digital e-kiosk has been set up at Delhi's Parliament Street police station to improve the interface between the public and the police, officials said on Sunday. The e-kiosk will enable people to easily lodge complaints in a contactless mode, they added. "The kiosk is very easy to access and senior citizens can...use it easily," a senior official said.

269.title: Wanted table reservation, no one knew me; no one had watched my film: Adarsh
269.article_body: 'The White Tiger' actor Adarsh Gourav said he got a "reality check" when he had to reserve a table at restaurant on Valentine's Day. "Every place was booked out...Someone suggested we pull strings...I made calls...and no one had even watched the film. Eventually, one place knew me. They gave me a table, that's because they weren't sold out," he said.

270.title: Irfan Pathan trolls Ravindra Jadeja for blinking too much during press conference
270.article_body: Former India all-rounder Irfan Pathan trolled Ravindra Jadeja for blinking too much during a press conference. Commenting on a video of Jadeja's press conference, Irfan tweeted, "Baapu needs eye drops." Responding to Irfan, Jadeja said that he was wearing lenses for the very first time. Irfan then joked the way he is batting, it seems he is wearing binoculars.

271.title: Latvia allows its citizens to fight in Ukraine amid Russian invasion
271.article_body: Latvian parliament on Monday voted unanimously to allow nationals to fight in Ukraine if willing amid the Russian invasion of the country. "Citizens who want to support Ukraine and...serve there to defend Ukraine's independence and our common security must be able to do so," a Latvian politician said. This comes a day after Latvia shut its airspace to Russian planes.

272.title: Ragpicker killed in Hyd due to chemical explosion in garbage bin
272.article_body: A 40-year-old woman ragpicker was killed due to a chemical explosion while segregating trash at a garbage bin in Hyderabad's Anandnagar on Sunday, police said. "A plastic tin containing unknown chemical exploded...[The deceased's] left hand was severed due to...blast and she died on the spot,” police added. The victim's husband, who was also picking up trash, survived the mishap.

273.title: North Korea says latest missile launch was to test cameras for satellite
273.article_body: North Korea has claimed that its missile launch on Sunday was part of a test for the development of a reconnaissance satellite system. The test helped confirm "the characteristics and working accuracy of a high-definition photographing system, data transmission system and altitude control devices", reported state media. Two photos showing the Korean Peninsula from space were also released.

274.title: SC to hear Cyrus Mistry's appeal to drop its remarks against him in 10 days
274.article_body: The Supreme Court on Monday agreed to hear former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry's appeal to expunge remarks made against him in the Court's 2021 verdict upholding Mistry's removal from the Tata Sons board. The plea said SC's remarks affect Mistry's "reputation, integrity and character". The Court said it will hear the plea in 10 days.

275.title: PM Modi is born in India to destroy demons, do welfare: Shivraj
275.article_body: Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan said that Prime Minister Narendra Modi was born in India to "destroy demons and for the welfare of people". "PM Modi...has decided to send four union ministers to ensure that every single Indian is evacuated safely from Ukraine," he said, adding, "It was due to PM Modi that vaccines were made in India."

276.title: We are ready for IPO but the markets aren't: MobiKwik Co-founder
276.article_body: MobiKwik will not be heading for its ₹1,900 crore IPO in this quarter, Co-founder Upasana Taku told Business Insider. Citing the conflict between Russia and Ukraine, Taku said, "I don't think it will be possible for any tech companies to IPO anytime soon." She added, "We're ready. Business performance is strong, SEBI approval is there. But the markets aren't ready."

277.title: Kangana calls herself 'real talent', says 'No mafia can beat honest work'
277.article_body: Rangoli Chandel took to Instagram to share a new still from her sister, Kangana Ranaut's upcoming film, 'Dhaakad'. Sharing the post, Rangoli wrote, "Hope Kangana...breaks her own records with Dhaakad this year." Reacting to it, Kangana wrote on her Instagram Stories, "It's a fight about me versus them. No mafia, no paid PR can beat real talent and honest work."

278.title: Huge traffic at B'luru-Mysuru road due to Cong's Mekedatu rally
278.article_body: As the Karnataka Congress resumed the Mekedatu rally, the Bengaluru-Mysuru road reported traffic congestion and people were advised to avoid the route. The march, which was suspended in January due to a surge in COVID-19 cases, will end at National College Grounds in Bengaluru. It is led by Congress' state chief DK Shivakumar and Leader of Opposition Siddaramaiah.

279.title: Harrison Ford's 'Indiana Jones 5' wraps production, to release in 2023
279.article_body: Harrison Ford-starrer 'Indiana Jones 5' has finished its production, the makers announced on Sunday. The fifth instalment in the 'Indiana Jones' franchise, directed by James Mangold, will also feature Phoebe Waller-Bridge, Thomas Kretschmann, Antonio Banderas and Mads Mikkelsen, among others. The action-adventure film is expected to release on June 30, 2023.

280.title: Why does Russian military equipment in Ukraine have a ‘Z’ symbol on them?
280.article_body: A military source in Ukraine said that the ‘Z’ marking along with other symbols are painted on Russian military vehicles so that they aren't confused with Ukrainian vehicles and the risk of friendly fire is reduced. Military experts also believe the symbols are likely to be connected to the geographic location of where the units would be deployed for combat.

281.title: 3 K'taka hijab case petitioners denied entry in college to attend practical exams
281.article_body: Three students were allegedly denied entry in Government PU College in Karnataka's Udupi to attend practical examinations on Monday. "The lecturer told me she'll accept my practical record book only if I remove my hijab," one of the students alleged. The three Class 12 science students are among six girls who have approached Karnataka High Court over the hijab row.

282.title: Infrastructure is biggest multiplier of investment: PM on PM Gati Shakti
282.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said the PM Gati Shakti initiative will not only lead to rapid infrastructure development but also generate employment. "Infrastructure is the biggest multiplier effect of investment. This also boosts the economic productivity of all other sectors," PM Modi added. Technology will play a major role in PM Gati Shakti, PM Modi stated.

283.title: Neighbours attack man in Guj, ask why he passes by their house daily
283.article_body: A 40-year-old man, Vali Meman, was allegedly attacked by his neighbours while he was out for his morning walk on Saturday in Ahmedabad. Meman said that his neighbour Annu and her son-in-law abused him and asked why he passed by her house every day. He said that his phone was also damaged when he tried to call the police.

284.title: Female Indian students picked up by Russian soldiers: Indian stuck in Ukraine
284.article_body: In a video shared by Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra, an Indian student in Ukraine's Kyiv appealed for help, saying, "We've been surrounded from all sides." She said she was told by a friend that Russian soldiers fired at some Indian students who were trying to escape. "They (the soldiers) picked up just the girls," she said.

285.title: Russia further isolated from international financial system, Putin must fail: UK
285.article_body: UK's Prime Minister Boris Johnson on Monday said, "We've further isolated Russia from the international financial system this morning." He added, "Working with our partners, and the G7, we are determined to impose the most severe economic measures possible against Russian President Vladimir Putin for his abhorrent campaign against Ukraine." The UK PM also said, "Putin must fail."

286.title: Dalit RTI activist allegedly beaten, forced to drink urine in MP
286.article_body: Shashikant Jatav, a 33-year-old Dalit Right to Information (RTI) activist, was allegedly beaten up and forced to drink urine by seven people on February 23 in Madhya Pradesh's Gwalior. He was attacked after he sought information related to the Barhi village panchayat. Jatav was locked up in a room and allegedly thrashed. The accused also made casteist remarks against him.

287.title: Realise the scale of Ukrainian heroism: Ukraine on map comparing Ukraine, Russia's size
287.article_body: Ukraine's official Twitter account shared a map comparing Ukraine's size to Russia's, which read, "Realise the scale of Ukrainian heroism." Ukraine also tweeted, "Don't be afraid to stand up to evil, no matter how powerful it seems, at the dawn, the flag will still be there." Ukraine on Monday said Russian troops have slowed down "the pace of the offensive".

288.title: EU shuts its airspace to Russian planes, to send fighter jets to Ukraine amid war
288.article_body: The European Union has said it will purchase and deliver weapons to Ukraine, while also strengthening sanctions against Russia including closing its airspace to Russian planes and banning state-owned Russian media. The EU countries will also send fighter jets to Ukraine at Kyiv's request to help it counter the Russian air and land assault.

289.title: Old income tax regime with deductions must go: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj
289.article_body: Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj has said that the old income tax regime must be disincentivised and the new regime must be incentivised with no exemptions. "The new regime will not take over unless we do so," Bajaj said. "What should the simple regime be? The simple regime should be broader tax slabs, lower taxes, no exemptions," he added.

290.title: We have been waiting for 6 years for this trophy: Shaheen on winning PSL 2022
290.article_body: Lahore Qalandars captain Shaheen Afridi thanked the fans and crowd after winning the seventh edition of the PSL on Sunday. "We have been waiting for six years...A lot of people supported me. The fight we showed as a team throughout the tournament is really fantastic," he added. Qalandars defeated Multan Sultans in the final to claim their maiden PSL trophy.

291.title: Norway wealth fund, world's largest, to divest its Russian assets
291.article_body:
Norway's $1.3 trillion sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, will divest its Russian assets following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "We have decided to freeze the fund's investments and have begun a process of selling out (of Russia)," Norwegian Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Støre
 said. Norges Bank Investment Management's (NBIM) Russian assets were worth $2.83 billion at the end of 2021.

292.title: Ukraine sets up 'Come Back Alive' hotline for families of Russian soldiers
292.article_body: Ukraine has set up a hotline for the family members of the Russian soldiers. Called "Come Back Alive from Ukraine", the hotline has reportedly received hundreds of calls since the invasion began. Through this hotline, families can enquire if their relatives are alive, taken prisoner or how can they get the bodies of the deceased ones.

293.title: Madhabi Puri Buch appointed as first woman Chairperson of SEBI
293.article_body: The government on Monday appointed Madhabi Puri Buch as the first woman chairperson of market regulator Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) for three years. Buch, a former SEBI Whole Time Member, will be replacing Ajay Tyagi whose tenure ends on February 28. Buch, who studied at IIM Ahmedabad, has previously worked at ICICI Bank and Greater Pacific Capital.

294.title: Benfica's Ukrainian footballer Yaremchuk breaks down after getting standing ovation
294.article_body: Portuguese football club Benfica's 26-year-old Ukrainian striker Roman Yaremchuk broke down after receiving a standing ovation from the entire stadium amid war in his home country. Yaremchuk was also handed the captain's armband after he came on to play in 62nd minute of their match against Vitória SC. Benfica shared a video, writing, "United!"

295.title: Non-violence is the only way: Dalai Lama on Russia-Ukraine war
295.article_body: Expressing anguish over war between Russia and Ukraine, Tibetan spiritual leader Dalai Lama on Monday called for peace to prevail. "War is out-dated - non-violence is the only way," he said in a statement on his website. "Our world has become so interdependent that violent conflict between two countries inevitably impacts the rest of the world," he added.

296.title: Russia wants to reach agreement with Ukraine: Russian negotiator
296.article_body: Russia is interested in coming to an agreement that is in the interests of both sides at talks with Ukraine, Russian negotiator Vladimir Medinsky said on Monday. Russia started its "special military operation" in Ukraine on Thursday.  Earlier today, Russian military claimed air superiority in Ukraine and alleged that Ukraine was using civilians as human "shield".

297.title: Till death neither will people of Kashi nor will Kashi leave me: PM Modi
297.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Sunday said that neither the people of Kashi nor will Kashi leave him till his death. "When I was publicly wished for my death in Kashi, I felt very happy. Even my fiercest opponents are seeing how much love the people of Kashi have for me," PM Modi added while addressing a public rally in Varanasi.

298.title: Smriti Mandhana, who was hit on the head in warm-up match, cleared for WC
298.article_body: India Women opener Smriti Mandhana, who was hit on the head during their first warm-up fixture against South Africa on Sunday, will play in the Women's ODI World Cup 2022 after being cleared of any serious head injury. Mandhana did not feel any concussion symptoms but retired hurt as a precaution, according to the medical staff.

299.title: I would love a character, used mom's make-up to dress like that: Avantika
299.article_body: 'Mithya' actress Avantika Dassani said that she would dress like the character that she loved in childhood. "Every time I would watch a movie and fall in love with a character, I would dress up like that, raiding my parents' closets, getting into my mom's make-up, and getting myself yelled at for the mess that I created," she added.

300.title: Selena trips in her heels at SAG Awards 2022; went on the stage barefoot
300.article_body: Singer-actor Selena Gomez, on Monday, tripped while walking the red carpet at SAG Awards 2022. A video surfaced on the internet in which Selena can be seen tripping in front of photographers in her black high heels. Post the incident, Selena seemingly decided to go barefoot to the stage. After seeing the video, her fans praised Selena for going barefoot.

301.title: It's for safety of your citizens you should vote to stop war: Ukraine as India abstained
301.article_body: After the UNSC voted on draft resolution deploring Russian invasion in Ukraine, Ukraine appeared to refer to India and said, "It's for the safety of your nationals in Ukraine that you should be the first to vote to stop the war." India abstained from voting, saying, it's concerned about the security of the Indian community including Indian students in Ukraine.

302.title: 3 employees of CNG pump in Gurugram hacked to death by armed miscreants
302.article_body: Three employees of a CNG pump in Gurugram's Sector 31 were hacked to death, police said. The deceased, all natives of Uttar Pradesh, were attacked with sharp weapons, police added. Police suspect robbery to be the motive behind the crime. A search has been launched to arrest the miscreants. An FIR is yet to be registered in the matter.

303.title: Russia forced to acknowledge suffering casualties for first time: UK on Ukraine invasion
303.article_body: UK's Ministry of Defence has shared the latest defence intelligence update on Ukraine. "Logistical failures and staunch Ukrainian resistance continue to frustrate the Russian advance," it said. It added, "Despite continued attempts to suppress details of the conflict from the Russian population, the Russian Armed Forces has for the first time been forced to acknowledge suffering casualties."

304.title: Salman Khan fails to perform 'Jumme Ki Raat' step with Pooja, video surfaces
304.article_body: Salman Khan tried to reenact a step from his song 'Jumme Ki Raat' with Pooja Hegde on stage during their Da-bangg tour in Dubai recently. However, he was unable to do the hook step as she was wearing a short bodycon dress. In the original song, which also featured Jacqueline Fernandez, Salman lifted her coat with his teeth and danced.

305.title: Kangana Ranaut's spy thriller 'Dhaakad' to release on May 27
305.article_body: Kangana Ranaut-starrer 'Dhaakad' is set to release in theatres on May 27. "The unstoppable force of #AgentAgni is fast approaching," Kangana wrote while announcing the release date. The spy thriller will hit the screens in four languages, including Hindi, Tamil, Telugu and Malayalam. Directed by Razneesh Ghai, 'Dhaakad' will also feature Arjun Rampal and Divya Dutta.

306.title: Shibani is Farhan's 'problem now', jokes Rhea; shares pic from their wedding
306.article_body: Rhea Chakraborty, on Sunday, shared a picture from Farhan Akhtar and Shibani Dandekar's wedding on her Instagram handle. "Mr and Mrs Akhtar, love is contagious, thank you for spreading so much love," she wrote, adding, "Shibani, you make the most beautiful bride in the world, I love you to moon and back. Farhan, she's your problem now, all the best."

307.title: Anti-war coalition in action: Ukraine Prez after talks with UK, Poland
307.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has said that an anti-war coalition was coming into action against the "aggressor" Russia after holding talks with UK PM Boris Johnson and Poland President Andrzej Duda. "Agreed on further joint steps to counter the aggressor. Anti-war coalition in action!" tweeted Zelenskyy. Johnson said he would do everything possible to provide defensive aid to Ukraine.

308.title: Maha cyber fraud victim calls helpline, asked to call in office hrs
308.article_body: A 47-year-old farmer from Maharashtra called the national helpline to report a cyber fraud that he was a victim of but was allegedly told to call "during office hours". "I called helpline number 1930 and narrated incident...man on helpline replied...their office was closed...asked me to call next day. I went to the police station the next day," farmer told police.

309.title: Russian troops have slowed down pace of the offensive: Ukraine
309.article_body: The Ukrainian military today said that Russian troops have slowed the pace of the offensive with their assault against Ukraine entering into its fifth day. The Ukrainian military added that Russian troops, however, are still trying to develop success in some areas. Ukraine on Sunday night claimed that it has killed and wounded over 4,300 Russian soldiers.

310.title: Russian central bank raises key interest rate to 20% from 9.5%
310.article_body: The Russian central bank on Monday raised its key interest rate to 20% from 9.5% to counter risks of rouble depreciation and higher inflation. Russia has also ordered companies to sell 80% of their foreign currency revenues. Several other measures were also announced by the bank to support domestic markets amid harsh Western sanctions.

311.title: Pune man gets 15-year jail for raping minor niece for 2 years
311.article_body: A 38-year-old man from Pune was sentenced to 15 years in jail for raping his minor niece for two years, while his wife was found guilty of hiding the crime. The man had offered shelter to the victim and her younger sister after their father died. The younger sister was also reportedly sexually harassed by their cousin.

312.title: Mayank Agarwal appointed captain of Punjab Kings
312.article_body: Mayank Agarwal has officially been named captain of Punjab Kings ahead of IPL 2022. "I've been at Punjab Kings since 2018 and I take a lot of pride in representing this fantastic unit. I'm delighted to be given the opportunity," Agarwal said. He added, "My job would be made easier with...talent we have in the Punjab Kings squad this season."

313.title: BJP workers clash with police in WB's Balurghat amid 12-hr 'bandh' call
313.article_body: BJP workers on Monday clashed with police personnel in West Bengal's Balurghat during protests against alleged violence in the state's civic polls. "Our workers were protesting peacefully, they are beaten up. Police are playing the role of a cadre for TMC, this is against democracy," WB BJP chief, Sukanta Majumdar said. BJP called for a 12-hour statewide bandh today.

314.title: India asks its citizens in Ukraine to move to Western parts as Kyiv lifts weekend curfew
314.article_body: Indian Embassy in Ukraine has asked all Indian students in the Ukrainian capital Kyiv to make their way to the railway station for onward journey to the western parts as weekend curfew has been lifted in Kyiv. "Ukraine Railways is putting special trains for evacuations," the Embassy tweeted. Around 16,000 Indian students are reported to be stranded in war-ridden Ukraine.

315.title: 4 new judges take oath of office in Delhi High Court; strength rises to 34
315.article_body: Delhi High Court Chief Justice DN Patel on Monday administered the oath of office to four new judges of the high court, including a woman. The new judges are Justice Neena Bansal Krishna, Justice Dinesh Kumar Sharma, Justice Anoop Kumar Mendiratta and Justice Sudhir Kumar Jain. The new appointments take the number of judges in Delhi HC to 34.

316.title: Want to go, my family needs me; it's dangerous: Ukraine citizen in India
316.article_body: A citizen of Ukraine in India said that she wants to go to Ukraine capital Kyiv. "I want to go to Kyiv as my family needs me in Ukraine. People can't buy food there as bombing is happening. So a dangerous situation out there," she said. Ukrainian nationals in India are reportedly approaching Ukrainian Embassy in Delhi regarding their families.

317.title: Sunday was tough: Ukraine military amid ‘continuous shelling from Russians’
317.article_body: The General Staff of Ukraine's Armed Forces said that Sunday was difficult for its forces as the Russian military continued "shelling in almost all directions". "The Air Force confronts the aggressor both in the sky and on the ground," it said on Facebook. It added that the Ukrainian forces managed to hold control over the aviation garrison in Vasylkiv.

318.title: RCB don't have batting depth, but bowling department is sensational: Hogg
318.article_body: During a question-answer session, ex-Australia cricketer Brad Hogg was asked about RCB's squad for IPL 2022. He responded, "They don't have that batting depth. They're going in with the same problems they had in the previous years...But their bowling department is sensational." He added, "Having Faf du Plessis with Virat Kohli is a better opening partnership."

319.title: Did riyaaz with him, not a day spent without missing: Sajid's daughter on Wajid
319.article_body: Muskaan Khan, daughter of music composer Sajid Khan, of the duo Sajid-Wajid, said that she used to do "riyaaz" with her late uncle Wajid Khan. "I used to watch...chacha Wajid do so much riyaaz...He had a guitar...and kept composing...I would do riyaaz with Wajid chacha...I don't think there is one day we can spend without missing him," she added.

320.title: Kohli can't be replaced at no. 3, Shreyas can bat at 4 or 5 in T20Is: Gavaskar
320.article_body: After India batter Shreyas Iyer scored 204 runs against Sri Lanka while batting at the number three position, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar said Virat Kohli remains irreplaceable at the position and Iyer will have to be slotted in at number four or five along with Suryakumar Yadav. "Top-batting line-up allows you to go in with pure bowlers," he added.

321.title: Indian students harassed by Ukraine soldiers after India abstains from UN vote
321.article_body: Indian students are allegedly harassed and beaten by Ukrainian officials at Poland border. A video shows Ukrainian soldiers firing in the air and forcing Indians back into Ukraine. Some students complained that they were kept in a hostage-like situation in the freezing cold and denied water and food. Notably, India twice abstained from voting at the UN on Ukraine crisis.

322.title: Russian vodka thrown out of several liquor stores in US, Canada; videos surface
322.article_body: Liquor stores across the US and Canada have been throwing out their Russian vodka stocks in a show of protest against Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Several videos of liquor store and bar owners emptying out their bottles and taking stocks off the shelves were widely shared on social media. Government officials in Canada's Ontario directed stores to remove Russian vodka.

323.title: Imposing marriage age on girls might not yield desired results: RSS women wing
323.article_body: RSS' women wing, Rashtriya Sevika Samiti, on Sunday said that girls should marry after getting proper education but suggested that "imposing" a marriage age might not yield desired results. "Such issues are better to be dealt with public awareness and holding wider discussions," Rashtriya Sevika Samiti's Sunila Sohwani said.

324.title: Video shows Indian students being beaten on Ukraine border
324.article_body: A video has been widely shared on social media showing Indian students being beaten on the Ukraine border. In the video, guards in uniforms can be seen manhandling students, including girls. Some students can also be seen screaming while pinned to the ground by the guards. Several Indians stuck in Ukraine have alleged they have been stopped from crossing borders.

325.title: Singer Mika Singh to have a swayamwar on national television: Reports
325.article_body: Singer Mika Singh will reportedly have his swayamwar on national television. According to reports, it'll be aired in a few months and Mika will not actually get married on the show. Instead, he'll only get engaged with the contestant whom he'd find the best. Women from all over the country will be allowed to participate in the swayamwar, reports added.

326.title: Will Smith wins Best Actor at SAG Awards, Jessica Chastain bags Best Actress
326.article_body: Will Smith bagged 'Outstanding Performance by a Male Actor in a Leading Role' at 28th Screen Actors Guild Awards (SAG) for his performance in 'King Richard'. The award for 'Outstanding Performance by a Female Actor in a Leading Role' went to Jessica Chastain for the film 'The Eyes of Tammy Faye'. The ceremony was held in California on February 27.

327.title: Russia's ruble falls 30% against US dollar amid sanctions over Ukraine invasion
327.article_body: Russia's ruble plunged nearly 30% against the dollar on Monday after world powers imposed sanctions on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. The ruble was indicated to be down 27% at 114.33 per dollar in offshore trading, according to Bloomberg News. The US and European Union said they would exclude some Russian banks from the international bank payments system SWIFT.

328.title: Heroin worth ₹56 crore seized from South African national at Mumbai airport
328.article_body: The Air Intelligence Unit of Mumbai Customs arrested a South African national for allegedly trying to smuggle eight kilograms of heroin worth ₹56 crore inside his luggage. "The seized NDPS substance...was concealed inside two small trolley bags and a handbag," an official said. The man had arrived at Mumbai airport from Johannesburg via Kigali.

329.title: India to send 4 ministers to Ukraine's neighbouring countries for evacuation of Indians
329.article_body: Union Ministers Hardeep Singh Puri, Jyotiraditya Scindia, Kiren Rijiju and Gen (Retd) VK Singh will be sent to neighbouring countries of Ukraine as Special Envoys of India. They will personally oversee the evacuation of Indians at the border areas. The decision was taken during a high-level meeting chaired by PM Narendra Modi today to discuss the Ukraine crisis.

330.title: ITBP Himveers play volleyball at 15,000 feet in -20°C, video surfaces
330.article_body: Indo-Tibetan Border Police took to Twitter to share a video of the Himveers playing volleyball in snow-clad area of Uttarakhand. "How is the Josh...Very high...Himveers of ITBP playing volleyball at 15,000 feet at a Border Out Post in Uttarakhand...Temperature around is minus 20 degree celsius," ITBP wrote on Twitter. In another video, Himveers can be seen patrolling at 14,000 feet.

331.title: He's selfless, wants each scene to be best: Vaani on Shamshera co-star Ranbir
331.article_body: Vaani Kapoor, sharing her experience of working with Ranbir Kapoor in the upcoming film 'Shamshera', said, "[He's] a pleasure to work with because he brings so much work ethic to the table." "He's...a selfless actor who wants to creatively collaborate so that each scene turns out to be the best," she added. 'Shamshera' is slated to release on July 22.

332.title: Death toll from earthquake in Indonesia reaches 11; rescue op on
332.article_body: The death toll due to the 6.2-magnitude earthquake which struck Indonesia on Friday climbed up to 11 on Sunday after rescuers recovered more bodies. The National Disaster Mitigation Agency spokesperson said that six people died in the Pasaman district, while five in the neighbouring West Pasaman. The rescuers are searching for four villagers that possibly got buried in rubble.

333.title: 7 named in FIR for raising 'Pakistan zindabad' slogans in UP's Prayagraj
333.article_body: Police have booked seven identified persons and several other unidentified people for allegedly raising "Pakistan zindabad" slogans in Uttar Pradesh's Prayagraj. "During preliminary inquiry, it has come to light that the persons named in the FIR are associated with the Samajwadi Party," Handia SHO said. "Police are trying to frame our party workers in false cases," Prayagraj SP chief said.

334.title: Woman scares people with cobra to extract money, police launches hunt
334.article_body: Tamil Nadu police are on a look out for a woman who allegedly scared people with a cobra to extract money from them. The police have filed a suo motu case against the woman after a video of her with cobra reportedly went viral. An officer said woman appeared to be nomad and snake charmer.

335.title: You're using Alia's name for attention: Payal Rohatgi to Kangana
335.article_body: According to the format of 'Lock Upp', actress Payal Rohatgi was given a set of charges, where she was supposed to defend herself. Payal was told by the show's host Kangana Ranaut that she cashes in on others' controversies for the sake of publicity. Reacting to it, Payal said, "I can also say...[You are using] Alia Bhatt's name...for...grabbing attention."

336.title: Australia to send lethal military weapons to help Ukraine in war
336.article_body: The Australian government on Monday announced that it will send lethal military equipment to Ukraine to help the country defend itself against the Russian attack. The details of the equipment consignment were not immediately known. This comes days after the country pledged non-lethal military equipment, medical supplies and financial aid to Ukraine amid the ongoing war.

337.title: 352 civilians including 14 children killed in Ukraine amid Russia's invasion
337.article_body: Ukraine's Health Ministry has informed that 352 civilians, including 14 children, have been killed since the beginning of Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Ukraine added that 1,684 people, including 116 children, have been wounded. While Russia claimed that its troops are targeting only Ukrainian military facilities, Ukraine said that Russia was lying about not shelling civilian infrastructure.

338.title: It inspired me a million times: Kili Paul after PM Modi's mention
338.article_body: Instagram sensation Kili Paul, who went viral for lip-syncing to Indian film songs, said it "inspired him a million times" after India's Prime Minister Narendra Modi mentioned him and his sister Neema Paul on his show Mann Ki Baat. Taking to Instagram, Kili Paul wrote, "Thank you, sir @narendramodi. I'm so mind blown to wake up to such beautiful news."

339.title: BJP calls for 12-hr bandh to protest against violence during WB civic polls
339.article_body: The BJP has called for a 12-hour statewide bandh in West Bengal on Monday in protest against alleged rigging and violence during the state’s civic polls. BJP spokesperson Samik Bhattacharya said the shutdown from 6 am to 6 pm will exempt essential services. "The elections have been reduced to a farce by the ruling party miscreants,"  Bhattacharya added.

340.title: Samson obviously hasn't grabbed his opportunities: Jaffer
340.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said he feels sad to see Sanju Samson not "grabbing his opportunities" in the three-match T20I series against Sri Lanka. "Samson does show the glimpse of what he can do but just doesn't take the opportunity that other guys have taken," Jaffer added. Samson batted in the final two T20Is and scored 39(25) and 18(12).

341.title: 66-year-old surgeon shot at in UP's Bareilly, one detained
341.article_body: One person was detained after a 66-year-old surgeon and the chancellor of a private university was allegedly shot at while he was returning home from his hospital in Bareilly on Saturday. The victim, Dr Keshav Kumar Agarwal, had stopped at a temple on his way home when he was attacked by a group of men, according to the police.

342.title: Whom did Rohit Sharma give the trophy just after winning the T20I series against SL?
342.article_body: Just after collecting the trophy after winning the T20I series against Sri Lanka, India captain Rohit Sharma handed over the trophy to Jaydev Shah and asked him to join the players for a group photo. Jaydev was the BCCI representative for the series. He is the former captain of Saurashtra and son of former BCCI Secretary Niranjan Shah.

343.title: 22-year-old Delhi man stabbed to death by friend over 'fancy, expensive' knife
343.article_body: A 22-year-old Delhi man was stabbed to death by one of his friends after he went to meet them for drinks. The accused revealed he was jealous of him as the latter had bought an "expensive and fancy knife", police said. He wanted the knife for himself and had asked the victim to lend it to him, but was refused.

344.title: Zirakpur-based realtor held for abducting workmate, snatching jewellery & cash
344.article_body: Police arrested a Zirakpur-based property dealer for abducting his workmate and snatching jewellery worth ₹2.5 lakh and ₹40,000 cash from his wife. Demanding money, the accused made the victim call his wife and threatened her with dire consequences if she didn’t show up soon. Later, they snatched her jewellery and cash, handed off her husband and escaped.

345.title: Bengaluru man gets 6 months imprisonment 19 yrs after causing accident
345.article_body: A truck driver from Bengaluru, Narayana Swamy, has been given six months of imprisonment for causing a fatal accident 19 years ago. He has been sent to Bengaluru Central Prison. The accident had taken place on March 24, 2003 when Swamy had mowed down a 60-year-old pedestrian, Rangaiah Naidu, near Seeta Circle, Banashankari III Stage.

346.title: UN General Assembly to hold emergency session over Ukraine in New York today
346.article_body: An emergency special session of the United Nations General Assembly will be held to discuss Russia's attack on Ukraine at UN Headquarters in New York today. Abdulla Shahid, President of the 76th session of the UN General Assembly, will preside over the session. Notably, the UN Security Council called for the emergency special session for the first time since 1982.

347.title: The real challenge for OTT is to keep the quality up: Shweta Tripathi
347.article_body: Actress Shweta Tripathi Sharma has said the "real challenge" for OTT platforms is to "keep the quality up, especially at a time when so many people are entering this space". The actress, who was part of shows like 'Mirzapur' and 'Yeh Kaali Kaali Ankhein', added, "Quality is the most important thing, no matter what the project or the platform is."

348.title: Kerala eases COVID-19 curbs; allows 100% occupancy in theatres, restaurants
348.article_body: Amid declining COVID-19 cases, the Kerala government has eased certain restrictions in the state. Hotels, bars, restaurants and theatres in Kerala are now allowed to operate at 100% seating capacity, state CMO stated. A maximum of 1,500 people, with one person in a 25-square-foot area, are allowed for public functions. All offices can hold meetings or training offline, as required.

349.title: We’ve been brothers for centuries: Russian billionaires want war to end
