349.article_body: Russian billionaires Mikhail Fridman and Oleg Deripaska have called for an end to the ongoing war between Russia and Ukraine. Fridman, who was born and raised in Ukraine, said that the conflict will cost lives and "damage two nations who have been brothers for hundreds of years". Deripaska said that peace talks should begin as fast as possible.

350.title: Once drugs enter your life, darkness envelops you: Hyderabad Police
350.article_body: Commissioner of Police of Cyberabad, M Stephen Raveendra, took to Twitter to share post to raise awareness about use of narcotics. "Drugs-Darkness, two very close words...Once drugs enter your life, darkness envelops you...Parents and educators, who are the gurus of the youth, should work towards raising awareness on drugs," he wrote, while also using hashtag "Say no to drugs".

351.title: Sensex drops 1,000 points, Nifty below 16,400 amid Russia-Ukraine war
351.article_body: Sensex fell more than 1,000 points to trade at around 54,850, while Nifty dropped over 280 points to 16,378. This comes amid the Russia-Ukraine war. Russian President Vladimir Putin on Sunday ordered nuclear forces to be put on high alert. Other Asian markets also plunged, with Japan's Nikkei falling 0.34% and Hong Kong's Hang Seng Index falling 1.49%.

352.title: Staying unbeaten commendable performance from my side: Shreyas
352.article_body: India batter Shreyas Iyer, who smashed three consecutive fifties and remained unbeaten in all three T20Is against Sri Lanka, has said it was a "commendable performance" from his side but he's not keeping any expectations. "I cannot talk about cementing my place, competition is so much, you need to be flexible in batting at any position," he added.

353.title: Shaheen hugs and lifts losing captain Rizwan minutes after winning PSL final, pics viral
353.article_body: Lahore Qalandars captain Shaheen Afridi hugged and lifted Multan Sultans captain Muhammad Rizwan minutes after leading the Lahore-based franchise to their first-ever Pakistan Super League (PSL) victory. "This is beautiful," a fan commented on the picture. Another fan commented, "No one can match the class of Rizwan." Another tweet read, "This is the beauty of cricket."

354.title: 2 empty bullet shells found in bus ferrying Sri Lanka cricketers in Chandigarh
354.article_body: The Chandigarh Police found two empty bullet shells from a private bus ferrying Sri Lanka cricketers staying at The Lalit hotel in Chandigarh's IT park.  The shells were found when players were about to board the bus from the hotel. "The shells were found in the luggage compartment...The bus driver is being questioned," a police officer said.

355.title: We, as Indians, love to work overtime and compare pain with others: Esha
355.article_body: Actress Esha Gupta said that she hopes that the world becomes more empathetic towards others especially after the pandemic. "We, as Indians, love to work overtime and work through the pain...We love to show we can work through crises and compare our pain with others, which is wrong," she said, adding, "We don't need to be proud about slogging ourselves."

356.title: India's daily COVID-19 cases fall below 10,000-mark; 8,013 cases, 119 deaths reported
356.article_body: India has reported 8,013 new COVID-19 cases and 119 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country reported 10,273 cases and 243 deaths. The COVID-19 daily positivity rate stands at 1.11% in the country, while the active caseload declined to 1,02,601.

357.title: Brazil Prez won’t pick sides, says Putin doesn’t want massacre
357.article_body: Brazil's President Jair Bolsonaro on Sunday said that he will remain neutral in the Russia-Ukraine conflict. "We will not take sides, we will continue being neutral and help with whatever is possible," he said. Refusing to condemn Russian President Vladimir Putin, Bolsonaro said, "A chief of state like that of Russia does not want to undertake a massacre, anywhere."

358.title: Plan was to give Bishnoi, Kuldeep match practice, that's why I didn't bowl: Jadeja
358.article_body: India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja, who picked a wicket each in the first two T20Is against Sri Lanka but didn't bowl in the final match, has said that the plan was to give Ravi Bishnoi and Kuldeep Yadav some match practice. Bishnoi picked a wicket while Kuldeep went wicketless in the game. Jadeja remained unbeaten at 22 to help India win.

359.title: Kharkiv governor shares pics of Russian soldiers who surrendered, calls them 'Clueless'
359.article_body: Kharkiv governor Oleh Synyehubov took to Facebook to share pictures of Russian soldiers who surrendered in Ukraine's second largest city. Claiming the Russian soldiers are clueless, Synyehubov said, "They have no connection with central command, they don't understand and don't know their further actions." He further wrote, "Since the beginning of the attack on Ukraine, they haven't received food."

360.title: It's been 3 yrs, haven't been paid for 'Dastaan-E-Mohabbat...': Sonarika
360.article_body: Actress Sonarika Bhadoria has claimed it's been three years but her dues for 'Dastaan-E-Mohabbat: Salim Anarkali', that aired in 2018, have not been cleared till now. "Not only mine but...dues of several other...actors and technicians from show are not paid. It was my worst time. Everything from my end in terms of legal formalities and paperwork is done," she added.

361.title: It made me the 'abba dabba jabba' girl: Upasana on 25 yrs of 'Judaai'
361.article_body: As 'Judaai' completed 25 years on Monday, actress Upasana Singh spoke about the romantic comedy film and said, "I played...a mother and mute woman, who just says 'abba dabba jabba'." "I wasn't convinced about it, but went with...director's conviction...And it clicked! It made me...'abba dabba jabba' girl," she added. Upasana said she's now making a film titled, 'Abba Dabba Jabba'.

362.title: Haryana officials get nearly 1,000 evacuation requests from Ukraine
362.article_body: Officials in Haryana have received nearly 1,000 requests from war-hit Ukraine for evacuation. Reports said that the requests were received from state residents, mostly students. The requests have come in through emails or messages at the helpline number introduced by the state government. Haryana officials have estimated that nearly 1,800 students from the state are stuck in Ukraine.

363.title: Crime rate reduced in UP during past 5 yrs under CM Yogi-led govt: Amit Shah
363.article_body: Union Home Minister and senior BJP leader Amit Shah said that the crime rate has reduced in Uttar Pradesh during the past five years under the leadership of CM Yogi Adityanath. "UP has recorded a decline of 70% in dacoity, 29% in murders, 69% in looting and 52% in rapes in the state under CM Yogi-led government," Shah added.

364.title: 21 school students stung by bees while trekking near Pune's Amba-Ambika caves
364.article_body: As many as 21 school students were hospitalised after being attacked by a swarm of bees while trekking near Amba-Ambika caves in Pune's Junnar, an official said. "Six of the students were in a somewhat critical state due to drop in blood pressure. All are stable now," said a toxinologist from a nursing home, where the students are being treated.

365.title: Planning to provide employment to at least one person of every family: UP CM
365.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath said BJP in the state is planning to provide government jobs, employment or self-employment opportunities to at least one person of every family in the next five years. CM Yogi was addressing a public rally on Sunday in Chauri Chaura, Gorakhpur. Polling for the fifth phase of UP Assembly elections concluded yesterday.

366.title: SDMC to build replicas of 15 dinosaurs using scrap at Sarai Kale Khan park
366.article_body: The South Delhi Municipal Corporation is planning to build replicas of 15 dinosaurs out of scrap material at a park in Sarai Kale Khan. The park already features replicas of the wonders of the world such as Taj Mahal, Eiffel Tower and Statue of Liberty created using waste material. The SDMC expects the revenue to increase up to ₹15 crore.

367.title: I would never say no: Sanya Malhotra on working with Shah Rukh Khan
367.article_body: Actress Sanya Malhotra spoke about actor Shah Rukh Khan producing 'Love Hostel'. She said, "It gives you confidence because he is King Khan as we all know him and he knows his scripts and the work that he does." When asked if she'd like to work with Shah Rukh in future, Sanya said, "I'm ready...I'd never say no."

368.title: Important to tell guys not worry about position in team: Rohit Sharma
368.article_body: India captain Rohit Sharma has said he wanted to understand the team's bench strength in the T20Is against Sri Lanka. "Good to give opportunities to those guys...[but it's] important to tell guys not to worry about your positions. I want to fill whatever gaps we have," he added. India made four changes to their playing XI for the third T20I.

369.title: Drunk couple on honeymoon booked for creating ruckus near Mumbai airport
369.article_body: A newly-married couple on their honeymoon was arrested for allegedly creating ruckus outside a five-star hotel near Mumbai airport. A police constable said they were screaming and fighting amongst themselves in an inebriated state because the woman wanted to go to a nightclub and her husband refused. The woman also allegedly engaged in a scuffle with the constable.

370.title: Belarus revokes non-nuclear status, paving way for Russia to place nuclear weapons in country
370.article_body: Ukraine's neighbour Belarus has passed a constitutional referendum revoking its non-nuclear status, paving way for Russian nuclear weapons to be placed in the country. "If you (the West) transfer nuclear weapons to Poland or Lithuania, to our borders, then I will turn to Putin to return the nuclear weapons that I gave away without any conditions," President Alexander Lukashenko said.

371.title: Chose to switch career, didn't go down well with her: Siddhant on breakup
371.article_body: Actor Siddhant Chaturvedi said that he had a "major heartbreak" in his 20s. "I had clarity when I was 20...I was with this girl for four years...wanted to settle down with her...but then I chose to switch my career. That didn't go down well with her...had to choose between love and ambition. And I chose ambition," he said.

372.title: 4 live bullets found in man's baggage at Delhi airport; arrested
372.article_body: Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) personnel on Sunday apprehended a passenger with four live bullets at Indira Gandhi International Airport in New Delhi. During the security check at Terminal 3 of IGI Airport, CISF found four live rounds of .32 mm calibre from the hand baggage of the passenger, identified as Kapil Vaish, who was bound for San Francisco.

373.title: Shreyas Iyer breaks record for scoring most runs in a 3-match T20I series for India
373.article_body: Team India batter Shreyas Iyer has broken the record for scoring most runs in a three-match T20I series for India. The 27-year-old scored 204 runs in the recently-concluded three-match T20I series against Sri Lanka. The previous record was held by Virat Kohli, who had scored 199 runs against Australia in 2016.

374.title: Chandigarh Airport likely to start direct flight to London by October
374.article_body: The Chandigarh International Airport is likely to start a direct flight to London by October. "The authorities had meeting with the British High Commission...Proposals have been sent...The direct flight will most likely be to the Heathrow Airport in London or Birmingham airport, which is around 170 km from the UK capital," said Chief Executive Officer of Chandigarh International Airport Limited.

375.title: Pulse polio drive begins in Pune; around 2.69 lakh vaccinated on first day
375.article_body: A pulse polio drive was started in Pune on Sunday with over around 2.69 children getting vaccinated on the first day of the campaign. PMC said it set up 1,425 booths across the city and engaged 4,180 employees for the purpose. "For the next five days we will have multiple teams conduct door-to-door vaccination drives," said a PMC official.

376.title: Voting in 38 seats underway in 1st phase of Manipur Assembly elections
376.article_body: The first phase of polling for the two-part Manipur Assembly elections began amid tight security at 7 am on Monday in 38 constituencies across five districts. As many as 173 candidates in the state are in the fray. According to state Chief Electoral Officer Rajesh Agrawal, 12,09,439 voters are expected to exercise their franchise across 1,721 polling stations.

377.title: World's largest plane destroyed by Russian forces, claims Ukraine
377.article_body: Ukraine's Ministry of Foreign Affairs has claimed that Russian forces have destroyed the world's largest plane, AN-225 'Mriya'. "They will never be able to destroy our dream of a strong, free and democratic European state. We shall prevail!" Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba tweeted. "We will rebuild the plane," the official Twitter handle of Ukraine wrote.

378.title: B'luru Police cover open city road, share before and after pics
378.article_body: Bengaluru Traffic Police took to Twitter to share before and after pictures of a city road after covering it up. "Officer and staff of station closed MES Outer Circular Road railway bridge near Jalahalli Traffic Police Station," police wrote. One Twitter user thanked police for "responsibility". "It is sad traffic police has to do this job," another wrote.

379.title: Why did India abstain from UNSC vote calling for General Assembly session on Ukraine?
379.article_body: Explaining its decision to abstain from UNSC procedural vote calling for an emergency General Assembly session on Ukraine situation, India said, "There is no other choice but to return to the path of diplomacy and dialogue." It added, "Our evacuation efforts have been adversely impacted by the complex and uncertain situation at border crossings."

380.title: Kept saying no to it, said yes for family; glad I signed it: Anil on 'Judaai'
380.article_body: As 'Judaai' clocked 25 years, actor Anil Kapoor said that he "kept saying no" to the film. "I could not connect with my character...I had a lot of pressure from family and the family production company as we were going through tough times financially...I am glad I said yes, as intention was to do it for the family," he added.

381.title: India abstains from UNSC vote calling for General Assembly session on Ukraine
381.article_body: India abstained from a procedural vote taken in UNSC to call for a special emergency session of UN General Assembly on Russia's aggression against Ukraine. China and UAE also abstained from the vote. Eleven UNSC members voted in favour of it, while Russia voted against it. Resolution was adopted as the vote was procedural and no member had a veto.

382.title: US urges its citizens to consider leaving Russia immediately
382.article_body: US' State Department on Sunday said that US citizens should consider leaving Russia immediately on commercial flights. It cited an increasing number of airlines cancelling flights and countries closing their airspace to Russia after Ukraine invasion. The State Department asked US citizens to have "a contingency plan that does not rely on US government assistance".

383.title: World's largest wealth fund to vote against Apple CEO's 2021 compensation
383.article_body: Norway's sovereign wealth fund, the world's largest, will vote against ratification of Apple's management remuneration plan. The development comes after proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services urged investors to vote against Apple CEO Tim Cook's compensation of $98.7 million for 2021. Norges Bank Investment Management, which operates the wealth fund, said it would follow the advice.

384.title: Liverpool defeat Chelsea 11-10 on penalties to win League Cup for record 9th time
384.article_body: Liverpool defeated Chelsea 11-10 on penalties in the final at Wembley Stadium to win League Cup for a record ninth time. Chelsea goalkeeper Kepa Arrizabalaga, who was brought on for penalty shoot-out in place of Edouard Mendy, was the only player from both the teams who missed a penalty. Chelsea finished as League Cup runners-up for the fourth time.

385.title: SIT will complete Anis Khan's death probe in 15 days: West Bengal DGP
385.article_body: Director-General of Police (West Bengal) Manoj Malviya on Sunday said that the Special Investigation Team's (SIT) probe into the death of student leader Anis Khan would be completed in 15 days. "We can't divulge any details as the case is monitored by Hon'ble High Court. But we will find the truth in the stipulated period," the DGP said.

386.title: Police help 80-yr-old patient in snowbound J&K area reach hospital
386.article_body: The police in J&K managed to save an 80-year-old critically ill patient after receiving a distress call from Karnah's forward Jabdi area on Sunday. The elderly man was in need of immediate medical attention but the road leading to the area was closed due to heavy snowfall. Police said their team arrived at the village and helped him reach hospital.

387.title: Turkish-made drones helping fight against Russia: Ukrainian envoy
387.article_body: The Ukrainian Ambassador to Turkey, Vasyl Bodnar, on Sunday said that the drones purchased from Turkey were very efficient in Ukraine's battle against the invading Russian forces. Turkey has sold several batches of Bayraktar TB2 drones to Ukraine. Earlier, Ukraine had deployed the drones against Russian-backed separatists in the country's eastern region.

388.title: Development of UP was never Akhilesh Yadav's priority: Yogi
388.article_body: While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur, UP Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath said that the development of the state was never the priority of Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav. "When I asked an SP leader to list the development work done under his party, he replied that infrastructure, medical facilities and roads were not their priority," the CM said.

389.title: Venkatesh is ahead of everyone in race for 2022 T20 WC spot: Irfan
389.article_body: Talking about Venkatesh Iyer, ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan said the all-rounder is "ahead of everyone in the race" for a spot in Indian squad for 2022 T20 World Cup in Australia. He explained that Venkatesh is batting at a strike rate of 180 at number six and has the height to get the bounce on the quick pitches in Australia.

390.title: Nepal's Parliament approves US-funded grant amid protests
390.article_body: Nepal's Parliament on Sunday approved a US-funded $500 million grant agreement as protesters opposed to the aid clashed with the police. The agreement seeks to fund the building of electric transmission lines and the improvement of national highways. Critics have claimed that the aid would undermine Nepal's laws and sovereignty as it will not have sufficient control over the projects.

391.title: 85 hrs of defence, difficult time will pass: Ukraine minister posts selfie with Prez
391.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov on Sunday posted a selfie with President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. He wrote, " 85h of defence...It's impossible to break our defenders, moreover, it's impossible to make the Kyiv lay down arms. The times are difficult, but it will pass...We’re already winning. Therefore, we advise the occupiers to go home. It's not too late."

392.title: K'taka CM lays foundation stone for late actor Ambareesh's memorial
392.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Sunday performed 'Bhoomi Pujan' for the memorial of late actor and former Union Minister Ambareesh at Bangalore's Kanteerava Studio. Recalling their 40-year-old friendship, Bommai said, "We used to eat and roam...together, did usual things and...unusual things." He further said the actor was born with leadership qualities and never compromised with his conscience.

393.title: Inflation will decline, will become normal in 8 months: Rajnath Singh
393.article_body: While addressing a rally in Uttar Pradesh's Azamgarh on Sunday, Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that "inflation will decline and will become normal in the next eight months." He also said that inflation was in double digits during Congress' tenure. Singh also commented on politics based on caste and said that it should only be based on "humanity and justice."

394.title: Protests against invasion of Ukraine held across Russia
394.article_body: Protests against the Russian invasion of Ukraine were held across Russia on Sunday, with protesters marching in city centres. Nearly 2,000 people have been detained in protests across 49 cities, according to independent protest monitoring group OVD-Info. The protests against the invasion started on Thursday in Russia and have continued daily ever since.

395.title: India register 2nd defeat at Men's Pro Hockey League, lose to Spain
395.article_body: Indian men's hockey team registered their second defeat at FIH Pro League after losing 3-5 to Spain in the second match of their two-legged tie at Kalinga Stadium on Sunday. Earlier this month, India had lost 2-5 to France in South Africa. India are currently second in the standings with 12 points from six matches, including four wins.

396.title: UK oil giant BP to exit its 19.75% shareholding in Russian oil firm Rosneft
396.article_body: British oil giant BP will exit its 19.75% shareholding in Russian government-owned oil firm Rosneft. "Russia's attack on Ukraine is an act of aggression that is having tragic consequences across the region," BP Chairman Helge Lund said. BP, which has operated in Russia for over 30 years, will no longer report reserves, production or profit for Rosneft.

397.title: Block Russian users' addresses: Ukraine to major crypto exchanges
397.article_body: Ukraine's Vice Prime Minister Mykhailo Fedorov has called on major crypto exchanges to block Russian users' addresses. He said that it was crucial "to sabotage ordinary users". He had earlier solicited information about crypto wallets associated with Russian and Belarusian politicians and said that the Ukrainian crypto community was ready to offer "a generous reward".

398.title: EU to fund purchase, delivery of weapons for Ukraine for the 1st time in history
398.article_body: Speaking about the Russia-Ukraine issue, President of the European Union commission Ursula von der Leyen on Sunday announced that for the first time ever, the EU will finance the purchase and delivery of weapons and equipment to a country under attack. She added that the EU will close its airspace for all Russian planes, including the private planes of oligarchs.

399.title: German journalist gets emotional, cries while translating Ukrainian Prez's speech
399.article_body: A German journalist became emotional and broke down in tears while translating Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's speech on Sunday. In a video of it, the translator can be heard crying and struggling to continue with her voiceover. In her translation, she said, "Russia is on the path of evil," after which in a muffled voice she said "sorry" and paused.

400.title: Jennifer Hudson wins Entertainer of the Year at NAACP Image Awards
400.article_body: Actress Jennifer Hudson was named the Entertainer of the Year and also won the award for Outstanding Actress in a Motion Picture at the 53rd NAACP Image Awards for her role in 'Respect'. Will Smith won the Outstanding Actor in a Motion Picture award for his film 'King Richard'. 'The Harder They Fall' won the award for Outstanding Motion Picture.

401.title: Hockey India congratulate Sreejesh on completing 250 international caps
401.article_body: Hockey India congratulated PR Sreejesh on completing 250 international caps for India after the goalkeeper reached this milestone during India's second leg against Spain at FIH Pro Hockey League on Sunday at Kalinga Stadium. "It's extremely special for me to achieve this incredible milestone...a lot of hard work and sacrifices have gone into this feat," said Sreejesh.

402.title: World's 6th richest man Buffett praises IITian Ajit Jain, calls hiring him 'perfect choice'
402.article_body: World's sixth richest man Warren Buffett praised Ajit Jain, who runs all of Berkshire's insurance operations, in his annual shareholder letter. Buffett revealed he hired Jain in 1986 even after Jain said he had no experience in insurance, and called his decision "as perfect a choice as could have been made". Jain, who hails from Odisha, studied at IIT Kharagpur.

403.title: Need to prepare for Ukrainian refugee influx: EU amid Russia tensions
403.article_body: European Union (EU) needs to prepare for "millions" of refugees from Ukraine who are crossing over to the bloc, EU official Ylva Johansson said. At least 3,00,000 Ukrainians have already arrived in neighbouring EU nations since Russian invasion, she added. Meanwhile, EU countries will soon decide on a resettlement programme for Ukrainian refugees, French Interior Minister Gerald Darmanin said.

404.title: Russia's military operation in Ukraine a brutal mistake: Sean Penn
404.article_body: Hollywood star Sean Penn has termed Russia's military operation in Ukraine a "brutal mistake". "If he [Russian President Vladimir Putin] doesn't relent, I believe Mr Putin will have made the most horrible mistake for all of humankind," Sean said. "If we allow it [Ukraine] to fight alone, our soul as America is lost," he added.
